reviewText:
DISCLAIMER: I'm a Naruto fan of the series, and can be considered a fanboy in most cases. However, I do give my most honest feedback on what I liked, and didn't like.
UPDATE: Ignore everything I said about the optimisation issues, it appears an attempt to fix the audio, the develoeprs somehow fixed the FPS as well! Running it at a steady 30FPS with no problems with my specs that I list below.

I'm going to be straight up honest with you, and say this game is beautiful. I'm a hardcore Naruto and fighting game fan, so of course I'm going to love STORM 4, but instead of making this review telling you how much I love it, I'm going to be naming everything that's not only good about the game, but also bad at the same time.

First of all, you should know playing this will spoil the Naruto Anime/Manga if you haven't watched/read either one, as it very well tells you the story from the point Naruto breaks Tobi's mask, to the very end of the series. Does that mean you should play the other STORM's? Or go finish the Anime and Manga? Well, it's all a matter of preference, because really, the game did spoil a LOT, but that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy it! I think I enjoyed it more than actually watching the Anime. So that answers that, but that's just my opinion. *flips riot helmet on*

Next, you should know STORM 4 now focuses on more slideshows. If you played or watched the previous STORM games, you'd know that it was all cinematic 3D cut scenes, while STORM 4 relies more on slideshows from the Anime. In my personal opinion, it was either a lazy move, or something they wanted to do it create a more unique STORM game. However you wish to take it as, that's how it is. Just keep in mind there's still a lot of those cool 3D cinematic's, k?

If you also haven't heard already, this is their last Naruto game, (Or just their last STORM game, not exactly sure) meaning there won't be anymore. Feel like picking up a Naruto game? This is the best choice hands down. Which yes, also means that this is the best Naruto game ever.

However, the game has a lot of negative aspects to it, which some don't annoy me TOO MUCH. For starters, the game is capped at 30FPS, and the support characters from the previous STORM games are not included in here, which to me, is a lazy move. Something else I found distasteful was the fact that the online hasn't changed much. It depends on both yours, and your opponents internet connection, and most annoying of all, still has no rage quitting penalty.

Now then, as for the game play and all the cool new graphics and features, just let me say that the new particles are BEAUTIFUL! JUST LOOK AT THIS.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=618088529
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=618087780
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=618088319

And that's just the tip of the iceberg, there's even more cooler looking ones. But keep in mind, with more better looking particles, the more it will take on your PC, which don't worry, I'll be covering these optimization issues, as well as away to actually fix it.

OK, here's a list of a whole bunch of features STORM 4 has, that its predecessors doesn't.
Leader switching; allows you in the middle of a fight, or even a combo to almost instantly switch your leader, allowing you to make a ton of cool new combos.
Armor destruction, which is one of my personal favorite features, as once your character is damaged at a certain extent, it will have a physical appearance on your clothes.
Attribute damage! Yes, this means water jutsu's are more effective while you're on water, and fire attacks will keep burning you until you extinguish yourself.
An amazingly bigger character roster.
Flashy new sound effects.
No longer the ability to flick into awakened mode, meaning that OP flick awakeners like TenTen are no longer a problem.
Completely incredible new particle effects.
Amazing modding community.
Beautiful team ultimate jutsu's, which are basically a special ultimate attack that depending on the team you have, unleashes a beautiful attack, just like this!
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=620428122
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=620427885
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=620427992


However, there's still some things that annoy me, no matter how much I love this game.
Such as:

Wall running being only available in story mode, while it was an actual feature in STORM 1.
Not being able to play in awakened mode from the start of a battle, which again, was doable in STORM 1.
More Anime cut scenes than actual cinematic's.
No rage quitting penalty.
A somewhat toxic community.

Some things that might annoy you (but haven't for me)
The game is capped at 30FPS.
No support characters from STORM 3 and Revolution (Rip Anko)
Overpowered Uchiha's

So, yeah, the game has its pros and cons, but the game, it's just amazing, I just simply love it with passion, I can't get over how much they've improved their game to be honest, I'm just finding it down right addictive. I'm sure that it isn't everyone's cup of tea, don't worry, I'm sure of that. I'm also sure that a lot of people are having a hard decision of buying STORM 4 because of its mixed reviews, but listen to me, they are just complaining about the Day 1 issues. What game that has ever been released, has NOT had its first day issues? None, none at all, it's completely impossible. But don't get me wrong, I'm not saying that as an excuse, as STORM 4 had probably one of the worst 1st day launch issues ever. However, that's no reason to give up on the game yet, as I've said multiple times, the game is amazing!

By now you're probably asking... Butt Juggernut

reviewText:
Pros:
1- stable game play
2- good online features
3- good for friends/family gatherings
4- nice preorder bonus ( even thought i wasnt the one that bought it )

Cons:
1- needs tweaking to work
2- low fps, should be raised to 60 minimum
3- has issues detecting Nvidia graphic cards ( fixed below )
4- story mode unlockable charcters are wayyyy to overpowered compared to other charcters
5- super hard bots are to easy to beat
6- handicap only powers up the opponent and not weaken the other charcter that mush ( tested it on max cap )
7- absurd amount of crashes without editing the game options and tweaking it

Guide to fix all possible crashes ( i can run it despite my processor being below the requirements ):
1- go to Nvidia Geforce control panel, set every thing to run automatically on Nvidia.
2- go to the config file in naruto folder and type the following in it:
iMaxdecalsperscale=100
FrameLimit=999
Framerate=60
3- set the .exe to run in compatable mode for windows 7 despite the version u are using.
4- disable shadows, vsync and all the useless settings and keep the game it 1280x720 so it doesnt crash midgame.
5- if it still doesnt run properly then make sure all your drivers are updated.
6- restart your computer and run the game.

my specs are: 2.70GHz. Nvidia gtx 980 DDrs. 16gb ram and i can run the game almost perfectly. still crashing? let me know and i might be able to help u.
side note: the ps4 version runs like 100+ fps, no single crash and not the slightest lag. a relative of my friend owns them and he had no issues it all

reviewText:
Important info before doing my review.

CPU: i5 3670k ( 3.40GHz )
GPU: GTX 670
I have not played the story mode yet. Just been doing online, and versus.

---
I normally don't do reviews, and I doubt my review will even be seen, but with the game getting bashed so hard. I wanted to give my opinion.
I had the game preordered, and saw the reviews were terrible, I was scared the game was going to be bad, and run badly.
So I started up the game.
And so far my experience with the game has been quite nice. I haven't had any of the issues others have had really. Maybe I'm just lucky.

There are some small problems with this game like audio, and the fact that we have to go through the config files to actually change some options. But they can easily be (and hopefully are) patched. And even with the small problems, I don't think it deserves to get slammed like it is now.

From what I have seen a lot of people having problems with the game don't even meet the min requirements for GPU and/or CPU.
There are exceptions of course of people with great cpus, and GPUs like 970s+ having problems.(Maybe is somehow more optimized for older GPUs? Idk). But again from what I have seen on the discussions page, a lot of the people complaining don't meet the requirements for this game at all. I think people just assumed because they could run Naruto UNS3, they could run this game as well or something.


In closing, the game isn't a bad port at all, BUT at the same time, it isn't a very good port either. It's pretty average, but the fanbase is making it seem like it's Batman AK.
If you actually meet the requirements of this game and want the game, buy it, you should be fine, and if not somehow, well at least steam refunds is a thing.


P.S. I've also played this on my friend's computer with a gtx 960, and it ran fine as well.

reviewText:
Alright i dont usually take time to write reviews but i will since i was very hyped for this game and I am a big Naruto fan.

Pros:
So let's be clear, the game itself is amazing, very well done story mode, even including bonus story. Tons of characters which is always what we all want from a fighting game. Graphics are great. You most likely will need skills to play online multiplayer (Competitive or not). Community is fantastic and very nice. Gameplay leaves incredible battles like you have never seen before from a fighting game. Every game you play as something new to offer. Every characters can be played in different ways which makes it almost impossible to actually say: I played all character and seen all ultimates/awakening and now its boring.

Cons:
Very bad optimized for computer. 30 fps lock.  Multiplayer servers from high distance countries will most likely be unplayable (US vs France by exemple). You cannot mute players you are fighting against (which can turn out extremely annoying in certain situations).


Finally, the game is amazing, there are way more pros than cons, and the bad reviews given to the game are almost only related to the 30 fps lock/bad optimization.

You should definitly buy this game if you are a Naruto fan or a fighting genre player.

reviewText:
I read a lot of people complaining about this game for some reasons, like the lags, crappy sounds and 30fps lock.
Im going the post my opnion, remember, everyone got his own opinion about something and this review is from a great naruto fan who read the whole manga.

To begin with, i had no problems with crappy sound or lags (exept when i used the Team awakening). Fortunately for other people, a patch came out and fixed these (i read the feedbacks of the community).

The game is 30fps locked for me... So what? I don't understand people who doesn't like a game just beceause it's 30 fps locked. The game is still much more than playable.



Now let's talk more about the game itself.
This is the last episode of the storm series and it explain the end of the manga, The Ten tails awakened, kaguya and more...

Sometimes they take some liberties and make battles that do not appear in the manga (Susanoo sasuke and madara sky battle for example) and it work very well, all the story is very similar to the original manga and very well animated.
Something to notice, THERE ARE NO FILLERS!!!

Let's talk about the few changes in the battles, so we have new characters: Six paths mode Naruto, rinnegan Sasuke, 10 tails obito and madara, rampage obito, Rin, Kaguya, Guy (All gates opened), Kakashi double sharingan,Sakura with the mark on her forehead (i always forget the name, damn...) , Naruto, Sasuke, Sakura and Hinata the last, Boruto, Sarada and Hanabi.


Now you can change characters IN battle and do some nice combos
Katon jutsus (Fire based techniques) will burn the enemy and his health will decrease
Raiton and Suiton jutsus (Lightning and Water based techniques) will get more powerful while standing above water.
While the storm jauge is full, you can do a team awakening.
Fights on the wall are back, but only in story mode :'(
Counter attack is not as powerful as in Revolution, it only knockback your enemy
The changes on the battle system are minor, but they are nice.


Last but not least, would i recommend this game for someone who aleready own a storm game?
I would say yes if he's a Naruto Fan, the battle system is still almost the same but the story mode really worth it!!!


Like i said before this is MY opinion as a Naruto fan and people who hate the manga WOULD certainely  hate the game aswell.

A gameplay video recorded by me: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1oLMEsnP5NE

I skipped the cutscenes to avoid as many spoilers as possible.
voteText: 43 of 50 people (86%) found this review helpful 5 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I wasn't going to write a review for this game, but there seems to be a huge misconception about what this game is, and so I thought I would clear it up.

There is a TLDR at the end, as this is fairly long, and I've split it up into four sections, one on gameplay, one on the single player, one on the technical issues, and then one on the gripes I do have with the game.

GAMEPLAY-

To start with, this game is purely fan service.  This is not meant to be a truly competitive fighting game.  Anyone who has played any of these games will know this.  But if you haven't, than know that to start.  But this is a good thing.

As I said this game is fan service.  It would make zero sense for pre time skip naruto to be as strong as Six Paths Madara.  They weren't even comparable in the manga/anime, why would they be in the game.  Lee would never be able to beat The Fourth, and Hinata would get crushed by Nagato every single time.

But that makes those moments when this happens EPIC.  You feel amazing beating Sasuke The Last as Lee, or Madara as Kiba.  It shouldn't happen, but it did and it feels great.  You know you are the under dog going in, and that makes it so much better when you win anyway.

The next thing I would say is that you shouldn't let the somewhat basic mechanics that the game has, for a lack of depth.  It is true that you will be smashing your B or Circle button the most, and your combos have more to do with properly timed cancels of limited number.  You are also severely limited in your Chakra, and that can be a game ender if you are against a good opponent.

People will run away and bait you out until you fall into the combo that they know will end the game.  They will be cheap, they will spam the OP characters.  How is this any different than how this would go in a real fight with these characters.

I know that there are a lot of people that like these games, but don't actually read or watch the manga/anime, but those that have, should not at all be surprised in this.  The game finds it's depth, in the quite likely accidental way that it is played.

You have to have a strategy.  You have to feel out your opponent.  You have to set a trap for them and win.  How many episodes and chapters of this show have involved that very thing.  You think one side is loosing, clearly getting shashed by their opponent.  Only to then realize that it has all been a set up, and they have their enemy right where they want them.

While a great deal of a Shinobi's power does come from their jutsu, and how strong of said jutsu they can use, a great deal of their victories, come from the decisions made, and their ability to follow their strengths, and strategies.

A duel between shinobi is just as much a mental game as it is a physical one.  And this game does a great job of representing this to the player.  If you create a synergistic team that complements each other, and know how to use them, you can beat anyone as long as you play to their strengths, and don't try to do things that they can't do.

SINGLE PLAYER-

As a huge fan of the show, this is a big draw to me, even though it is short.  It is very well done.  There is honestly more cut scenes and dialogue than fighting going on, but it still felt good.  I think it took me about 10 hours to finish the story, doing the few side story things along the way.  It could easily be done in a handful of hours I feel if you were to skip through it all.

The way they blend the game play into the cinematics is jarring though.  As the Anime has not finished, only the manga, there were no scenes from the show that they could use for the cinematics, and so they are rendered in game, and use the same models as the ones you use to play.  This odd blending can make it a bit hard to stay immersed fully, but that is a small complaint, and while it can be arguable as to how good of a practice it is, I can see the value in using assets from the show that are already made for you.  It cuts costs, from a business stand point, but it also minimalizes your work, you don't have to painstakingly recreate these scenes, and then get torn apart because you got some parts wrong.  There is nothing worse than a developer instilling their vision" of a story that has already been told
date: and making it worse because of their changes.  And they don't do that here.\n\nI would caution you though
recommended: since the Anime has not finished

reviewText:
After reading the first reviews after the initial launch of this game here on Steam,
I had lost most hope for this game..
But let me tell you, people are over-exaggerating this game to DEATH.
The mechanical issues some people have stated this game to have are false,
or exaggerated at least in my case.
The only mechnical issues I've encountered were pretty random but massive framedrops.
And I agree that those shouldn't be there when you're running the game on some high specs.
There's also a lack of graphical settings in the options menu, but for me it's no big deal.
30 fps lock, I couldn't care less.

But then again I never understood people ranting about fps in the first place,
as long as watching it doesn't make me feel nauseous, I'm fine with the fps.
I just wanted to get this shiggery out of the way.
My point is, that I don't care much for all this fancy stuff.
I'm all about the actual game, you want a better port?
Go buy yourself a Playstation 4 or XBONE.

The game itself is pretty much what you would expect from a Ultimate Ninja Storm sequel.
New Storyline, couple new characters and some changes to the gameplay mechanics.
I'll talk about those next.

The Story in this one isn't really anything special, it's Naruto.. Whaddya expect?
But this is the end, the final chapter of Ultimate Ninja Storm games.

As mentioned before, couple new characters were also added..
And I have to say I'm very dissappointed.
I feel like they're not even trying to listen to their fans.
So many characters have been requested to be put into these games,
yet we have none of those. WHERE IS ANKO, I ASK YOU BANDAI?
Oh jeesh, thanks for giving us another Sasuke character,
as if those 6 other Sasukes weren't enough. To make things even worse,
after they gave us characters people wanted the least,
they proceeded to lock away 2 of the characters as Pre-Order bonuses.

Now, I was lucky enough to get the Pre-Order copy but it saddens me
because I know there are people out there,
who deeply love Naruto as a series,
and were looking forward to playing this game but were spit'd on by Bandai.
You should never, and I mean never lock away characters from a FIGHTING GAME.
You're not delivering a complete product when you lock away characters.
Costumes I have no issues with but never f*cking lock away characters again.
Also, to go back and talk more about the technical issues of this game..
As I said before, I don't really care about how good of a pc port this game is.
As long as it works, I'm alright with it..
But I am sick and tired of Bandai and some other companies ( Tecmo cough cough )
For not showing any f*cking respect towards pc gamers,
why is it that we get treated worse than console gamers?
Is it because PC ports are so much harder to make work properly?
Or is it because you ignorant baztards label us all as people who pirate video-games?
I think it's the latter.
I honestly think they treat us like sh*t and give us more inferior products
because they don't respect us.
And that is disgusting,
especially since Naruto is a huge franchise and its fans have made it what it is today.
And many of those fans are indeed, pc gamers. So please, start showing some respect.

Well, now that's out of the way so I can finally continue talk about the freakin' game.
They made some rather interesting gameplay changes, which I approve of.
In previous titles you were able to summon 2 support characters in middle of a 1v1 battle,
they would do one of their signature attacks, and that was about it for them.
This time around you can actually switch the characters in middle of a battle.
You can still only play with 1 character and use the others as support if you want to, for example..
If the match proves easy for you, you might not even need the other characters.
Tag Fighting is what I would call it,
you can now play 3v3 same way as you would in the Dead or Alive series ( which is 2v2 though )
or in the King of Fighters series.

I SHALL NOW PROCEED TO PRAISE BANDAI
FOR NOT F*CKING UP WITH THEIR DLC COSMETICS,
Yes, they actually handed this one very well. You can actually UNLOCK costumes in this game,
no DLC costume packs. Hooray!
You can now unlock all the costumes, and there's plenty of them.
It'll take some grinding to gather up the in game currencies
but at least you don't have to pay for the stuff.
This of course, is partially due to all the costumes being from the previous UNS Revolutions game.
So it would be very wrong of them to ask money for the costumes, again.
But hey, I'm more surprised that they didn't do that. Which is sad.

But hey good job Bandai, this goes to show that you guys do want us to not hate you..
That was a weird sentence.
There of course, is the Season Pass..
Which has yet to be released. And according to its information,
It'll include new characters, costumes etc. *sighs*
Oh well.. I desperately hope at least one of the following characters would be included :
Anko, Zetsu, Kurenai, Hayate and maybe even Dosu or Zaku from the original series.
It would be really cool to see their Otogakure" abilites in the game.
We need more variety in characters.
Sure
date: the character roster is already kind of big but think about it
recommended:
over 10 character slots have gone to different versions of Naruto / Sasuke.


Also
hoursPlayed:
I totally forgot to mention.. but the games graphics have been significantly upgraded.
The animations and effects all look very good. That's the best I can tell you.
I'm a total tard when it comes to technical bullsh*ggery.

reviewText:
Crashes
The game is highly likely to crash when it's played on Windows 10 , so I wouldn't recommend playing this on W10. Of course , other people might be able to run it in W10 , but that's the issue that I faced

Storyline
The  Story Mode	 starts from the very beginning , from Uchiha Madara against Hashirama Senju ( The First Hokage ) till the very end : fighting against Kaguya and  The New Age  , which features Sarada Uchiha and Boruto Uzumaki. You can only unlock Boruto and Sarada if you pre-ordered the game though.

Overall
This game is one of a kind , completely different from the previous installments which were  NARUTO SHIPPUDEN: Ultimate Ninja STORM 3 Full Burst	 and  NARUTO SHIPPUDEN: Ultimate Ninja STORM Revolution	 . Full Burst has a Story Mode , while Revolution has an Adventure Mode , with a  Mecha Maruto	 story line that's unrelated to the anime. Storm 4 has both Story Mode and Adventure Mode , so it's definitely worth your money.

Gameplay
The game works fine for me .

Rating
10/10

reviewText:
Not recommended for those who didn't watch or read Naruto. Otherwise - a must have for any Naruto fan.This is by far the best Storm game in my opinion. Naturally, it would make it better if developers could bring back such features as 4th combo, jutsu clashes, wall running, Storm 1 free roam, etc.. I could ramble about this for hours but nevermind that. They don't care anyways.. What's done is done and those removed features probably won't comeback ever.
So here's a handful of pros:• Storyline picks up from where Storm 3 left off and covers everything what's left. It's amazing as always: beautiful visuals, stunning boss battles.
• Biggest roster yet with the ability to choose between several jutsu for your character. Some characters got rebalanced or slightly changed.
• Leader switch system. It changed the game drastically. The transition is very smooth and fluid and is accessible almost anytime.
• Rounds (best of 3). Matches are longer, therefore,  you gain a chance to analyze your opponent and make huge comebacks in the rounds to come.
• Elemental effects.
• Charged chakra dash.
• Reworked counter which helps to balance the game out.
• Upgraded visuals (more sparkles, particles), some objects and buildings can be destroyed on stage.
• Faster loading screens. (or should I say instant?)
• Better online experience: smoother battles, fixed ranked system, matching voices, character usage top.

+- A little bit better in-game settings but still has a lot of room for improvement

Cons:• Ugh.. Adventure mode. Boring and unnecessary like in previous games.
• Rare frame drops.
• A few stages have been removed.
• Character accessories are gone (I wasn't a fan of them anyways)
• Ruined tournament mode.
• Frequent disconnections while in the middle of the match.
• Since this is the last Storm game, it lacks some new characters that were forgotten (like Swordsmen). An update to the majority of characters is needed too.
• Still images taken from the anime (with added effects like water splash or camera shake) during the first half of the game. All the other cutscenes are pre-rendered. Thus, their quality is pretty sloppy.
• Bingo book freezes the game.
• No mute option.
• Multiple exploits
• A sh*tload of disk locked costumes from previous Storm games which were made into paid DLCs. Although they are easily unlocked by modders and it also works online.

Generally, despite having some flaws, this game is really enjoyable. 9/10
My Storm Revolution review
My Storm 3 review

reviewText:
Before I start, this is MY opinion of the game. Everyone has different opinions and views of this game and thats fine by me!

First off, I was not expecting to actually be able to play this game since I know my computer is not that good in specs and graphics and I just wanted to have it whenever I am able to update my computer. But I got lucky since I tried the game out anyway and was able to play it at around 20-25 fps, which I can personally deal with.

Singleplayer:

I really enjoyed the story mode a lot. Great fight scenes especially with the boss battles and quick times events. The only thing that I did not like was many of the cutscenes just have still images with voice overs compared to the awesome CGI ones. There is still some CGI cutscenes but compared to Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 (which was all CGI), it left me disappointed.

Free Battle is off course what it sounds like, able to battle with any characters you want which is fun. The different combat moves and special moves are awesome to see, with many big explosions. Many different characters to choose from as well which are easy to pick up since they follow the same combat input combinations. There are also other modes such as survival which can keep you occupied.

In adventure mode, you can use Naruto (and if you have the DLC like me, use Shikamaru with Garra coming later) which allows you to explore the different locations such as Konoha while having a main quest to do along with fun side quests mixed in adding to more content.

Collection is there to see everything you have bought from the Bandi Store including pictures for your multiplayer card to new costumes from past games for your characters. It is a lot of content to buy and again would keep you busy to get all the content.

Multiplayer:

I do not play multiplayer since my game has slow fps. But if you do go into the multiplayer menu, there are special events that is only singleplayer which they update about every week that you can gain certain awards so that is pretty cool, especially for someone like me who is not really a big fan of multiplayer anyway.

All in all, I really enjoy this game and being a Naruto fan this is pretty sweet. Personally, I give it a 8.5/10.

reviewText:
I really have no idea what people are complaining about.
NSUNR4 runs perfectly on my R9 270x TOXIC without any stutters.

reviewText:
Legendary game series. Increasingly fast paced, aggressive, and engaging of your personal strategy.  imagine if these guys had more than a year to actually sit back and make a Naruto game, not developed on the cash cow mentality schedule of their distributor Bandai Namco...
because despite that drawback, I'm happy to say this is already a finished product in terms of the gameplay; almost entirely fleshed out fighter in it's vision and it's vision is unique.

That vision includes a very varied gameplay compared to other fighters. This game *will* keep you on your toes playing online, learning to use your diverse range of options against your opponent.  Pick it up with a friend IRL and hash it out as well because there's much to be found.

ALSO DEFINITELY A MUST BUY IF A FAN OF THE NARUTO MANGA OR ANIME! Really does the climax of the series justice. The tiers of characters in this game align very well with the powers of the characters in the anime, and for 100+ character roster, that's saying a lot!

There was alot of addition to the game, giant battles, tons of new characters, awakening and secret jutsu in the same mode, as well as awesome graphics. Would I recommend the game?
Only if the game gets a patch for the fps issue.

reviewText:
This is not a game; this is a love letter to all naruto lovers, that being said the game isn’t running well...at all. For allot of people with allot more powerful rigs.

Firstly things you should know:

1. If you are a laptop user, the game might try and run off integrated graphics card, change it to your proper card.
2. RESTART after downloading, Don’t SHUT DOWN (like I did XD) or nothing will be fixed.
3. To change resolution and things like that go to config" and manually edit it. It’s not advanced or complex at all.

MY SPEC
i3 3.1
GTX 660
8GB DDR 3 ram
Windows 8.1

30 to 25 FPS constant.

Pros:

+ Graphics

better than previous titles with over the top jutsu animations.

Cons:

reviewText:
Finally we get to see the end of Naruto!  This my friends is not the Anime full of fillers we see week in and out!

+Gorgeous graphics, better than the anime!
+Runs smooth on my rig, no hiccups.
+Nice music goes well with the game.
+Different language tracks +++ (can not stand that english dub)

-Weird slow motion glitch, took a reboot to correct it
-Had to enable Vsync in the config file no option from within the game
-SSAA had to be enabled in the config file

Please read below!

Outside of the weird slow motion glitch (a quick reboot corrected that) this game has been awesome.  I am not sure why so many folks are having the issues they are (under powered machines?  No idea my 2nd gen i7 and GTX 760 is handling it just fine).  I play on a customer built desktop and it runs smooth.  No sound issues, no lagging...good to go! Again outside of the weird slow motion menu glitch its been great.  Insanely beautiful graphics (I play at 1080p, and don't mind the 30 fps...guess I'm not a super 4k/60 FPS snob?), perfect control as one would expect from the 4th game in the series, and finally being able to see the end of the series (thank goodness no filler).  All in all I am happy with the game and looking forward to the future DLC.

reviewText:
Naruto Fans with a good GPU should wait for a sale
Summary:

This is a mixed bag review from a fan. If you are interested in Naruto, the headline applies to you. Otherwise, there are better fighters out there. Harsh, but this is how I feel.

It feels like this game was made to end the franchise rather than give you the best, last experience. Always nice to have a decent story in fighters, but the long-term aspects found in successful fighting games were neglected. My hours weren't spent training, getting better just happened, but there is no fufillment in improvment outside of messing with people online. I spent the time looking for the game's redemptive qualities, the results are below.

PROS:

- Decent Story Mode Overall
(A short 4-5 hours, probably couldn't be helped. They tried to stay true to the manga.)
- Simple New Mechanics, best in the franchise (still has problems)
- New characters are satisfying.
- Some minor details from previous games. (YOH!)
- Best Visuals in the franchise hands down.
- Less frustrating Ranking system in Multiplayer.
- DLC offered is ok, outside the lack of quantity.

CONS:

- Bad/Shortened re-playability outside of story:
X Cannot spectate in player matches. (A must have in Endless Mode)
X Frustrating netcode, disconnects in low ping.
X Lack of possible maps and content: story mode environments both in this game and previous, were not transferred into free-battle or multiplayer. (Possible 40 map limit)
X Lowered room capacity in Endless matches.

- Adventure Mode is lame, DLC content is added to this mode:
X Walking Simulator with fights and fetch missions, it's a chore.
X Storytelling does not live up to the effort put into Story Mode.
X The interface of the story mode is a timeline, the DLC added to adventure would've been better as a new story mode timeline.
X I think content here should've been used to increase the length of story mode.

- Story mode tried to tie a few of the scenes together with lackluster image stills.
- Wildly unbalanced hitboxes
- Cannot mute (either) mic in Multiplayer.
- On Disk DLC, made worse by exclusive DLC that some will never be able to buy.

(These affect the game as a sequel)
- There were characters already half-made in previous games and were not re-introduced into Storm 4 (except sound 4, 7 swordsmen shoe-horned as an Ultimate Attack instead of characters, both sold separately ).
- Every fighting franchise recycles move-sets, but it was not handled consistently here.
- It wasn't ok to resell old skins to the fans.

reviewText:
Naruto Shippuden Ultimate Ninja Storm 4, in a nutshell, is simply the best of all from the series.

PROS

1. Graphic (only if your specs allows)

Compared to the previous few, NSUNS4 has terrific graphic even at 1280x800. The cut-scenes, jutsu and fight scenes makes it almost close to watching the anime.

2. Controls

Simple combinations of buttons on controller just like the previous series. Nothing much to explain on it other than the fact that even ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ can easily pull off an ultimate jutsu

3. Story mode

While I personally do not really like the previous one with mecha-naruto, this story mode simply blows your mind off.
It makes you feel as if you are watching the anime, only that you get to control the characters of the scene to do your bidding. My personal favourite would be the Naruto and Sasuke episode. The whole gameplay for that chapter is filled with emotions that gave me tears in my eyes, and the last time i felt that way from Naruto was when I read the arc where Naruto found out about the news of Jiraiya's death.

4. Characters

Naruto and Hinata from The Last. still a better love story than Twilight.
Oh! and Hanabi is so adorable, both from the Adventure and The Last.

CONS

While there are so many positive points one can find in this game, the downside is that the game is easily cleared within days (3 for myself) when one is so familiar with the combo list. In my opinion, it would be perfect if consumers can choose the level of difficulties at the start menu (correct me if i am wrong but so far i am sure i couldn't find anything about difficulty settings).

In conclusion, I would rate the game 9/10 and recommend anybody who is interested, to definitely get the game. (do check your PC specs first)

reviewText:
True to the source material, good fighter(best anime fighter available...) great visuals to the point that you often can mistake certain scenes for being straight from the anime... I was lucky enough not to have any major issues aside from story cutscene dialog only playing voice in one ear (when that's fixed, this game could be perfect!) online netcode can be iffy if you're not battling someone near you, but when you get a good network match it's a great time... so many different varied characters/costumes, all with unique animations and movesets, I'd recommend this over any current fighters, to the point where I think I may even like it more than tekken 6.

a mechanic unique to this include being able to swap between 3 characters, with 1 as leader, and other two as support, either call them in as support, or switch to them (even mid combo, to extend your combo further,), which brings good levels of dynamicism to the game as you can swap to a ranged character after you've picked up some distance, and when you're closing in on someone switch to a cqc fighter, a well balanced team is a good part of whether you win or not now.

that said, there are people with issues, if you crash a whole bunch on windows 10 (Every 15-20 minutes) you should go to services.msc and disable off touch keyboard and handwriting service, if you have low fps(NVIDIA), you should go to your nvidia control panel and make sure your global setting is,(or add nsuns4.exe and set to) your high performance nvidia graphics card instead of integrated... when all issues are fixed this game is easily a 10/10 for both a fighter and true to the anime game, the last game I played so close to source material was south park the stick of truth.

reviewText:
I was excited to play this with my friends. Then I found out that it doesn't support a gamepad. So one of us used to Xbox 360 control which worked fine, then the other had to use a keyboard.... for a fighting game? A KEYBOARD? After playing so many hours on a PS3 and Xbox contoller, I find out that I have to use a keyboard to have any fun at all with my friends? Except we didn't have much fun. I have looked at some discussions but have found nothing that works for me. The gamepad works just fine with Naruto UNS 3 Full Burst, so why doesn't it work this this game?! I am disappointed.

Other things I have experienced:

- Dialog in cinematic scenes comes can be heard only in left speaker (Fixed)
- Lag/FPS drop during awakening (very minor issue although worth mentioning)
- Screen tearing! No V-Sync option (Especially on the more cinematic fights)
- Terrible lag in online battes.
(I have played on my friend's PS4 and the experience was so much smoother. I have never had a smooth Naruto UNS online match before on PC. I did a bit a of research and many people say that both players need good connections and a PC that can constantly put out 30 FPS in order for smooth gameplay online. Some people do not have problems at all (from what I read) so wheather or not I can blame CC2 for laggy online gameplay is debatable. Just for reference, I am not running the game a toaster PC)
(EDIT: Playing with people within your region who have 3 bars of connectivity will give you a smooth experience!)

On the bright side...:
(Note that I have not played UNS Revolution so I do not know if these changes were made in that game. If these changes were already present in Revolution, this is my first time experiencing them)

- Addtional characters
- Beautiful new effects/details
- New sound effects
- More story
- Allows you to switch between characters mid-fight (Health remains the same)
- Sweet looking Ultimate team finishers if the right charcters are selected

Keep in mind these are the only things I have experienced. Other players have experienced worse. If you don't mind the negatives, then the game should be pretty good for you. Still, I'd say hold off until the game is patched up. Paying $50 for a product, I expect it to be working correctly and I won't stand for crappy ports.

Alot of sound problems were fixed up too, I'll change the review to positive now.

Original Review:

Okay, I'm going to start this off as someone whom plays the STORM series nonstop.
I have nearly 2k hours on both Storm 3 & Revolution & love it to death.

Storm 4 as a sequel is a great addition to the series
HOWEVER, the game is TERRIBLY Optimized.

On my PC which is above the minimum requirements, the game only runs 10fps in a slow-mo state & ontop of that, the settings themselves are horrible too compared to previous title.
Strangely enough you get more options in the settings now though.

Storm 3 & Revolution had a settings launcher which gave tons of resoluions, v-sync, windowed mode, & super-sampling. On here, you get a config.ini which is the only way to enable v-sync.

You have go in-game & to the settings to change:
- Resolution (you only get two options, or atleast I did,
changing it in the config will bug up & provides no additional boost in FPS),
- Shadow Detail,
- Motion Blur,
- Glare, &
- FXAA

I also heard that the games story can crash on users too, I haven't been able to check because my game runs so slow, it took 15 minutes before I could start the very first scenes of the game & didn't have the patience.

Weirdly though, if I go into Character Customisation or Presets, the game will go into 30fps, but will go back to 10 when going back to the menus. (the game is locked into 30fps, like all the rest).

TL;DR: Horribly Optimized, not worth anything until patched.
Even to people whom love the storm series.

If they fix these bugs (just the 10 FPS bug is enough for me), I will change this review to a positive, but I'm not removing the other cons to entice people without their knowledge.

Pros:
- New Character Swapping Mechanics
- No more choosing between types, Ultimate Jutsu, Awakening, & Drive are all in one now.
- Story mode goes onto the end of the manga
- Fixed crash bugs from Storm 3 & Revolution, like Shisuis Neutral Combo.

Cons:
- 10 FPS Slow-mo even with requirements (Fixed)
- Sound issues for other users
- Story mode crashes for other users
- Lack of settings
- 30 FPS Locked (even though, I really don't care for that.)

reviewText:
Most reviews that i saw were about the performance issues which yeah they were bad but once the fixes and patches came you shouldve been enjoying a incredibly well detailed game.

First off what an incredible journey it has been....ive been a huge Naruto fan since first opening pages of a Shonen Jump and couldnt keep away. Best anime series second to Dragon Ball Z...and im glad that as an adult i finally get to see how the story ends... With that being said ive played every storm game except the very first one only due to fact that i didnt own a playstation 3 but i did play its counter part the Rise of a Ninja and The Broken Bond...i started with storm 2 and watched how the gameplay mechanics have changed sooo much and can honestly say this is the best storm game if you really want it to feel like elite ninjas are fighting. I feel like the characters movements and speeds really get  captured in this game....and if they do make another game keep it in this format please...

The story of Storm 4 is incredible. biggest flaw is they didnt use animated cutscenes for everything which means a portion of it felt like i was watching a read along book....but when cutscenes were available they amazing and gorgeous, they took the time to make everything work and feel genuine to the story. I love how they incorporate the flashback aspect of the series into it which if youve watched previous series and episodes you lknow there is some very heart wrenching moments...

I dont play much online but will continue to play adventure mode to see whats that like..

Sadly this will be my final Storm game and to stop with the best game is how ill stand.

Overall Score 10/10

reviewText:
Great game , works fine for me. i'm using a AMD R7 370 and i have 16gb ram and a I3-4130.

the game it's locked on 30fps, but it's really smooth and don't drop. also i noticed one part of story mode that FPS drops a lot on ps4, but here it was fixed 30fps with no drops. which is nice.

played some story mode and free battle. working great.

Good things:

-about the game has a great amount of characters.
12 new if you played revolution, if skiped revolution you will have a lot more.

-switching characters during the battle it's fun and works really well.

-some characters got nice upgrades in the awakenings and ultimate jutsu. (not all unfortunally)

-The new Round system it's interresting and gives a fresh way to battle.

-Some Boss battles are really nice and fun to do

-Team awakenings

-Has unlockables costumes of previous games and itens that you can get materials easy by just playing , even in versus.

-My Xbox 360 controller worked really good and with the another program and manage to use my Dual Shock 4 also.

------------------------

some bad things :
-The story has no much cutscenes in the beginning for those who like (i don't care much)

-Adventure mode looks a little boring

Online:

besides that, the max i had it was a small delay input but not too problematic.

but CC2 needs to put a mute option, cause hearing the other player random noises and complains it's really annoying.

In general, i having a lots of fun in this game and  recommend for those who loves the series. but keep in my that requires a good pc.

Hope that helps in your decision, and more i play the game (adventure) i will update the review ^^

reviewText:
This is it. The final part of Naruto Shippuden translated into gameplay, something which the anime still hasn't delivered to us. Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 or NUNS4 starts off with some backstory on who is fighting against who and for what cause which provides some great fights with a fun combat style and a interactive cinematic quick time event finish for most of them that both Naruto fans new and old can enjoy. Other than the main story mode the game has other modes as well which I'll go explain based on how they appear on the main menu (You could also skip to the conclusion if you don't want a detailed explanation of what each game mode has to offer)

STORY
The story mode covers both backstory for some of the main key characters in the 4th great ninja war as well as everything from when the ten tails is first summoned all the way up to the final fight" as well as a nice ending cutscene.

ADVENTURE
Adventure is a more open-world take on story telling covering a mini arc that happens in between the ending of Shippuden and The Last: Naruto the Movie. To me it felt more like a filler episode but enjoyable nonetheless. In this story Naruto reminiscences of stories dating back from when he was a kid up until this point serving as memorable battles that are a blast from the past. Also mentioned before you can roam around the ninja world just as the after game in Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 (Full Burst) but other than completing some of the side quests there isn't that much to explore.

*There are also extra DLC stories of which 2 are out right now featuring Shikamaru and Gaara as the main characters.

COLLECTION
As always there is a lot to collect
date:
some of which you can buy here ranging from voice clips to costumes for characters. You should have enough money to buy what you want after play through the story once. I never felt like I had to grind to get more money.

ONLINE BATTLE
As I am not a competitive or "pvp" player I cannot accurately review this game mode however I do know that if you're into online pvp and ranked systems this mode will probably satisfy your needs.

FREE BATTLE
I feel like the name for this mode does not do the actual content justice. There are so many extra game modes hidden away in this non-descriptive name that I could probably split this part up by itself. I'll try to keep it short though. Free battle contains a training mode where you can just test out various characters/teams against a npc as well as a Survival and League mode which mode add a new twist to the regular matches and are definitely worth checking out.

CONCLUSION
NUNS4 is THE ending I wanted for this amazing franchise. With a giant roster of countless memorable characters and adding on to the gameplay showing that the Ultimate Ninja Storm series has an ever evolving combat system by now giving you abilities like switching character mid fight or breaking the weapons/armour of your opponent. The game looks even more stunning whilst still maintaining the same style as previous titles in the franchise HOWEVER this comes with a cost
recommended: the system requirements have been boosted up so I did have to play on low settings to achieve a stable fps count. Anyways if you are a fan of Naruto you really gotta pick up this game as it is the epic conclusion to an epic story as I hope this is not the end but a standard that should be achieved once again as I hope for a Boruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm 5.\n\n*Disclaimer: Sorry if there are any spelling/grammar mistakes
hoursPlayed: English is not my native language and I only did a quick spell-check after what kinda seems like writing a book in and of itself. I did this after finishing all of the achievements and purely out of the love for the game/franchise and as such this review is kinda biased(Believe it!)."

reviewText:
Okay, I'm upset. I really wanted to give this game a positive review but I can't. I experience massive amounts of screen tearing every time I boot it up. My pc isn't a toaster by any means. I have an i5 6600 3.3 GHz, 8GB of RAM DDR4, and a GTX 960 4GB VRAM. So let's run down the problem with the port.

-30fps lock
-15ps-10fps when navigating menus
-slowdown
-input lag
-sound lag
-screen tearing
-no V-sync option
-There's a delay with QTE in Story mode and they prompts don't appear when they are supposed to so you can in turn fail the QTE
-I was lucky enough not to experience this myself but when you try to play online the menus will lag in navigation and if you accept a match you will be booted back to the start screen.

I'm honestly disappointed in Bandai and CC2. They said they were going to make the game for PC in mind (a damn lie) and they were going to target 60fps. If CC2 couldn't get the game to be 60fps then they just should have handed it over to DIMPS seeing as how they make great ports and can get games to run at 60fps. If they manage to fix it I will change my review but in the meantime I do not recommend that you purchase this game. If you're eligible for a refund I would suggest that you get it.

It's honestly sad that there's this mentality that we must buy bad ports to prove that we want more games on Steam even though it's been proven if you have a great port people will buy it simply because they want to see more great games that are well optimized on Steam. Say no to bad ports on Steam. First Tales of Symphonia and now storm. This is not acceptable Bandai.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m39tRc2f35E

A review of my experience with this game.

reviewText:
So prefacing this:
I love this series
This game is great when it works.

The PC version is pretty rough and the majority of it for me seems to have to do with framerate dips around button prompts and the menu (though I've no clue why. Restarting the computer before each time I load it up fixes this completely.)

It is worth mentioning (though through coincidence not much problem to me) that the resolutions are limited. You can fix this by fiddling with .ini files but they should just provide all the most common resolutions to begin with. The game runs at 30FPS and in my opinion still feels pretty fluid, but I also kind of don't care about things like that, particularly with games like this.
In its current state I don't want to recommend this game because people shouldn't have to fish around for issues just to play the game.

But

If you want to deal with that, have a decent computer and a controller it's really fun and pleasant to watch and kind of encapsulates everything the anime could have potentially been. Gamewise I recommend it, and if you want to get it the console versions are probably better at this point in time. I feel like whatever's going on with the menus can be fixed in a patch so be on the lookout for that or maybe a sale.

It can definitely stand to have more graphical options though, this game is pretty and not having a couple more kinda limits that.

Oh and pre-order exclusive characters is just really really irritating. I don't mind buying them but at least give me the option.

reviewText:
I've played Storm 3 and Revolution, and really enjoyed playing both of those with friends.  The gameplay mechanics are improved and there's a great deal of added depth and complexity for players who wish to play competitively.

However, I cannot find a single scrap within myself to recommend this game to an average consumer.

STORY/SINGLEPLAYER:

It's grossly full of laziness and poor effort.  The cutscenes are literally stills straight from the anime.  The fights are braindead simple, as the AI is designed so that a child mashing a single button can beat the entire campaign.  This may seem besides the main point, as story modes are often neglected in fighting games so that the emphasis of the developers is on delivering a rich multiplayer experience.  However, that front does not deliver either.

MULTIPLAYER:

One word: lag.  It's chockful of it.  The lag you'll experience is horrendous to the point where you'll find it difficult to input any commands unless you're mashing the button.  For some bizarre reason, it's also tied to FPS, so if you're playing against someone with 10 FPS, for example, while you're playing at 30 FPS, you'll experience massive stutter that will legimately make the match unplayable.  There is no specatating in this game, so you won't even be able to view anyone else's match online.  The ranking system is a joke, as anyone can disconnect from a losing game without penalty.  The developers have also not improved the amateurish setup of online play since Storm 3 so random disconnects trying to get into a game are still a problem.

I will continue playing this game solely because I like playing the local multiplayer with pals.  If you don't have anyone to play with locally, don't buy this game.  The netcode is brutally awful and makes for an extremely uncompetitive and unreliable environment.

All modern fighting games need a strong online multiplayer foundation.  It's a necessity, not an option.  Without having that foundation, Storm 4 will never possess the reliable playerbase and the longevity that other fighting games currently have.

reviewText:
This is my first Storm game, I've played a bit of revolution with my friend.

First the visuals are not too great because there's no SSAA, so I turned up the resolution to 4K in the config.ini file (yes it's stupid that I have to go into the game's files to change the resolution since there's no option for it in game). 4K looks amazing tho there's only one issue with scaling on the finishing images.

The game runs smoothly for me at a 30fps lock. A lot of people are experiencing problems with their games running at really bad framerates. Developers might release an optimisation soon or it's just that their computers aren't powerful enough.

Online: I've only played a few matches online, I've only expierenced a half laggy battle once, the rest were smooth. I haven't experienced any spammers (though I don't think this exists in this game since it so easy to block jutsus or ultimate jutsus)

Story: I've only played the first chapter but it's really good so far, I really like the Quick time events, they're just fun to do, and the visuals in story oh.my.god amazing.

There's a lot of playable characters in storm 4, actually there's so much I haven't even played with like 1/10th of them xD The costumes are pretty cool and if you're a huge fan of the anime (like me) then you'll love the costumes.

That's pretty much all I can say about this game right now, so far it's 8/10 for me.

reviewText:
- I both love and hate Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4. As a fan of the anime and manga, I expected lots of intense action from what’s been presented as the final game of the Ultimate Ninja Storm series, and to its credit, Storm 4 delivers. The characters and over-the-top battles look and feel great, and the story pays off in a satisfying way. On the other hand, even the best combat system in the world would be wasted if there are no worthy opponents to be found.

- Pros:
* Fan-pleasing story mode
* Strong versus and online modes
* Huge roster of characters
* Fantastic anime graphics
* Three-character fights

- Cons:
* Utterly bewildering for non-fans
* Steep learning curve
* Interminable cut-scenes
* Poor AI
* Shallow Adventure mode
* Connection issues
* Bad optimized


- I hope the dev will fix the problem in game!

reviewText:
I'm going to try my best to give you guys that are on the fence about Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 a good representation of the GAME this review is mostly because I'm tired of Steam User Reviews being all about the specs and not about the content of the game. I'm going to be using a bullet point format so you can pick out what you like and what you dislike. Also just as a repeat I'm not going to be talking about the quality of the port (resolutions, sound quality, game settings etc... trust me nobody was hit harder than me with these settings seeing as though I have a 4k monitor and was forced to run at 1080p)

The Good
> Does a good job keeping the overall story mode feel from the previous titles
> The fighting (Although repititive if you played previous titles) is solid and does a good job implementing quite a few new combinations in terms of team battle
> The Game includes more tutorials than previous titles showing you how to do all of the (basic) things you will need to know to  chain together combos
(I will try adding onto this list as I get more experience with the new elements and such just an early review for now)
> Kunai knives now do chip damage if you played previous titles you know the embarassment when your mounting a comeback and then taken down by a measly kunai knife

The Bad
> If you played previous Ninja Storm Titles or just watched or read the Anime or the Manga the story can feel uhhh... Kind of forced
> Some characters are still unfit to go up against other characters in other words (Over and underpowered characters)
> When you are playing the game the effects make it kind of hard to see your enemy at times (This can be seen as a good because it gives you the oppurtunity to use this to your advantage to block your enemies view and use that time to mount an attack)
> This.... is the biggest thing for me.... THE FACIAL EXPRESSIONS! OH GOD! THEY ARE THE UGLIEST THING I'VE EVER SEEN!
> The UI is still the same UI from Ninja Storm: Revolution
> Main menu animations just lack the uhh... Ninja Storm Animated feel?
(Stay tuned for more negatives as I endeaviour more into this game!)

(I will try adding onto this list as I get more experience with the new elements and such just an early review for now)
> Kunai knives now do chip damage if you played previous titles you know the embarassment when your mounting a comeback and then taken down by a measly kunai knife

The Bad
> If you played previous Ninja Storm Titles or just watched or read the Anime or the Manga the story can feel uhhh... Kind of forced
> Some characters are still unfit to go up against other characters in other words (Over and underpowered characters)
> When you are playing the game the effects make it kind of hard to see your enemy at times (This can be seen as a good because it gives you the oppurtunity to use this to your advantage to block your enemies view and use that time to mount an attack)
> This.... is the biggest thing for me.... THE FACIAL EXPRESSIONS! OH GOD! THEY ARE THE UGLIEST THING I'VE EVER SEEN!
> The UI is still the same UI from Ninja Storm: Revolution
> Main menu animations just lack the uhh... Ninja Storm Animated feel?
(Stay tuned for more negatives as I endeaviour more into this game!)

reviewText:
For preordering game with season pass I got:
• 30 fps-lock (it's okay, when it is stable 30 fps, which is not the case here)
• Sound issues (static noise and actor
arrator voices only from left speaker) (fixed 12.02.2016)
• V-sync only enables through config .ini file
• No SSAA (It is listed in .ini file, but doesn't work)
• FPS drops to below 20 in some story cutscenes as well as during Awakenings cutscenes (unintentionally fixed with audio patch from 12.02.2016)
• Remeber those sweet in-game animated cutscenes from previous games? Mostly abscent in this one, now we have still frames from anime series. Not animated at all, just pictures.
• Also, interactive battlefields like in first fight/demo? Only in first fight/demo, nowhere else you can pick up any sort of weapon etc. or ruin the arena.

i5 4590
GTX 960 2GB
8GB Ram

reviewText: A great game if you work hard on it! What I mean by that is to you fixate it or modify it to make your PC handle it well. I have Intel Graphics 5000, with a 4th Gen i5 processor, and the game never dips below 27 fps because of my modifications (Which aren't to do at all if you kinda know your way around and unless i'm using a heavy mod or i'm doing a heavy UJ or Awakening, it usually doesn't dip.) The game is fun and clean, although there are many crashes. I have to use a mod to get the characters I can't unlock through story mode, only because I can't get past the Hashirama v Madara level without the game crashing, even with the particles removed or changed. If not for the crashes, I would give this a 9/10. But because of that (And the adventure mode, which is kinda boring), I rate this a weak 7.5/10. Fix the crashes CC2!

reviewText:
I've finally finished the story for this game and as far as how it tells the tale is pretty good, much better than usual anyways. I think it does an excellent job of delivering plenty of story content and any who enjoys the series should definitely grab the game, some of the specialized fights are extremely fun and creative. You can tell they put a lot of work into the game to develop it very well, I haven't yet tried Adventure mode unfortunately.

The only real con I have is that the characters are completely without balance at all, I understand it isn't exactly an E-sport game but many of the characters just have blatantly unfair advantages compared to most characters. It isn't like you'll be unable to beat story mode but you'll definitely find yourself throwing the controller from a BS combo or CPU specific ability getting an insanely lucky combo on you that ruins your S rank attempt or even drops you to B. I have to say that it does suck that the best way to obtain rank S in story is basically just spam your regular ninjutsu (not your special one) and hope for a lucky streak usually you can recover most of the chakra used before they get up, and if you have most of your substitutions the CPU generally won't rush you to stop it either. This is especially effective with characters like Senjutsu Naruto who has a thrown Ninjutsu with extreme range. Otherwise you'll find yourself restarting fights dozens of times each, the boss battles are very very unbalanced as well, the ones with the gigantic fighting or non-character players are generally way too easy, you can get S in these AND do the extra objectives almost accidentally. But the boss battles with regular characters seem overtuned, their ability to spam jutsu and substitution will have you screaming at your screen, yet again the best thing to do is spam single load ninjutsu (they almost always dodge/block double load with insanely inhuman speed). Overall the AI for this game is completely out of whack, at first it seems like a good challenge but it is realistically just their reflexes turned up to insane levels.

Besides the bad character balance and the overtuned AI, the design of the characters is very fluid, some of them have abilities that are blatantly ridiculous of course (pretty much any character that teleports will be easy to win S ranks with). But besides that they look and feel great to play, probably their least balanced game ever but out of the ultimate ninja series their story-telling and design level is out of this world this time around.

reviewText: What i came into this game wanting was as solid a story mode as the previous games (Minus revelations and generations). What i got however was multiple still images with effects plastered on the top earlier on in the game then later a cascade of cutscenes to break up bossfights that feel like they should be hard but end up being very easy. In ninja storm 3 it felt like you were playing the story, being able to move around the world and take part in side missions and extra stuff, in this its boss battle>exhibition>boss battle>exhibition which left me with a sour taste in my mouth as this feels like a huge leap backwards in terms of how the story is being told in the game. Add as many impressive special effects as you want it wont stop the fact that this feels like playing the arcade mode of a generic beatemup rather than a story over 10 years in the making in the fact that i could just get the same effect playing the online mode and watching the anime. also the literally translated japanese dialogue and narration comes across as stilted and awkward compared to how it felt in the manga, could be that it is more noticed due to the impressive amount of exhibition in the game.

reviewText:
Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this game for now.
The game plays mostly at 22 FPS, the game is very badly optimized (since nowadays developers doesn't seems to care nor either to know how).
There are many stages missing such as The Tenchi Bridge, stages that would have been great to play on especially since it is supposedly the last Naruto game.
There are also characters missing such as Kurenai, Anko, Shizune and the sound four.
The sound four are probably gonna be playable in the up-coming DLC.
That's nice isn't? Nope it is not, it is the worse thing I ever seen, but with nowadays developers, it's nothing new, we get ****ed by a bunch of incompetents who are good at nothing but cheating people.
A future DLC or expansion should be something new, something totally new, have new ideas of characters? Exclusives characters from other games? Go for it but characters that should be in the base game right away?
That's just pathetic, no really, It's pathetic.
You guys should be ashamed of yourself.
Kurenai, Anko and Shizune are probably never gonna be playable which is really dumb too since they were playable in the older games.

For now that's all what I can think of so I'm giving this game a 4.5/10 for the moment.
Overall, It could be a great game if the game wasn't that badly unoptimized and if we could get the basic stuff (stages and characters that should be in the game and damn, even some costumes).
For now, I would wait for an update, the game plays better while fighting, in the menu, it is very laggy, this is not normal nor acceptable and hopefully they will remove the 30 fps lock, we're talking about the PC here and it's 2016, PC games were playable at 60 fps even back in 2000 damn it.

reviewText: After the patch, I can now recommend this game. It stays true to the franchise in terms of gameplay and graphics, while improving on the aspects of the previous games. I love the new combat mechanic of tag team
date:
where you can switch between up to three characters during a fight. It adds a new dynamic and makes for some really intense fights and satisfying combos. The combat is still easy to pick up, but difficult to master due to the fast pace. Graphics are great and the animations are a pleasure to watch. The game is locked at 30 fps, so consider that before buying. It would be nice to have 60+ fps, but as long as there is no stuttering, it doesn't bother me. Prior to the patch, there were some optimization issues. But, those have been solved in my case. I'm not sure about eveyone else though. Character selection is great with many to choose from. People are complaining that not that many fighters were added compared to the previous game, but I don't mind since this is the first Storm game I've purchased. Likewise, some animations and movesets are the same as the previous game. Overall, if you want to enjoy the end of the Naruto Shippuden before the anime catches up, pick up this game. I believe it's the best anime fighting game out there.

Specs:
EVGA 660 Ti
i7 - 2600 @ 3.40 Ghz
16 Gb RAM
Windows 7 64-bit

reviewText:
Usually I don't write reviews, but seeing a lot of negative reviews here made me write finally at least a little one... :D

So a lot of people were complaining about the performance, but a lot of other people (including me) did actually not have much problems. I played the story mode without a single unexpected error, the game did not even crash ( and that was even before some patches came out). The only problem I had was a strange audio issue (sound completly messed up) when starting the game for the first time... yet it was pretty easy fixable with some adjustments to my own audio settings.

Regarding the performance, this game is solid, it runs absolutely smooth, I did not have any frame drops and the 30FPS-Lock did not bother me actually, because it somehow did not feel like 30FPS... Maybe I got used to it quick, don't know.

Now in general:

PROS:

- Just epic...
- A lot of content like tons of playable characters with different outfits (even if a lot are recycled from the past games but the more the better... right?)
- Combat System improved, it feels better now and you can change your fighter during the fights
- Great Story, epic fights... and no filler episodes! :D
- A lot of special Team Jutsus, which are really nice (but some ofc are from the past games)
- Graphics improved since the last game
- Japanese Voice acting is awesome, just like in the anime

CONS:
- During the story instead of showing animated dialogues you somtimes just get a picture with little animations and dialogue...I mean its understandable they save up a little work there so they could focus on other epic staged fights
- I started the story with english dub, but some actors had a different (worse) voice than in the anime... instantly turned to japanse dub
- Storytelling is often during a fight and its sometimes hard to focus on the dialogues while beating your opponent... though its not that negative... only sometimes
- Adventure mode is a little bit... well just to extend the playtime for a little while, not really something more, but not that bad. The Story between Naruto and Hinate there is cute, but too short ( Just watch the Naruto Movie The Last" if you want see the story between these two :) )
- I tried the multiplayer a bit
date: but several times the connection was not really great
recommended: the input had always at least a slight delay in it... and besides the opponents spam their moves like hell
hoursPlayed: while shouting smth to their mum
voteText: crying or coughing into the microphone
helpfulPercent: unaware that I can hear them :D  Yet probably funny against friends.\n\nTo sum it up
votesHelpful: this is probably the best naruto game and holds up a greatly done (really animated) ending to the naruto-series and  everyone being annoyed by all the filler-episodes in the anime can definetly finish the story of naruto here in this game without regrets."

reviewText:
Well my fellow Naruto fans. Storm 4 is here! Believe it! The finale in the storm series has made its way on the market, and its on steam! To think for one moment I would be playing storm 4 on my pc is pretty unbelievable. Its been a great journey ever since the very first storm game.

Now I know alot of people are going to be scratching their heads. Storm 4 on steam has been given a mixed score. So most people are wondering with the amount of negative reviews there are of why ive taken the liberty of giving a postive review. Well let me just say that it isn't neccisarly the game itself, but more in terms of functionality.

For starters, many peole are complaining about -

- The 30 FPS Lock
-Lag (Which reguardless of your specs you will get)
-Crashing
-Audio and visual glitches
-Game is apparently in full japanese for some people?
-Same game pads aren't working

Now these are just some of the issues, as there are more, more being so in terms of adjusting the quality and visuals of the game. Now let me just say this. My specs can't run alot of games on steam that come out. I have an ASUS gaming laptop, my GPU is a 765M (horrible GPU) while my CPU is a 4700HQ, and with all the issues i've listed, the 30 FPS lock as well as lag have been my only issues, which everyone will get reguardless of their specs.

In other words, if you are thinking of getting this game but afraid that it won't work for you, don't be, because in most cases the game will work just fine as long as your specs are more then whats required. My GPU is worse then the required GPU and the game works perfectly fine besides the lag. And even if it doesn't work, there is always steam refund.

Whether Cyber Connect 2 fixes these issues, its hard to say, but reguardless fan-made patches will be made eventually.


I do plan to give a solid review after I play through the games story mode and beat it. So far the game is looking good. Highly reccomend you get it.

reviewText:
Although the pc has some issues with frame rate and other tech issues, i would still recommend this game to fans of the series.


The gameplay is familiar but with some major things added as well.
-story
i have not completed the story but right off the bat i notice a great change of pace from this game and ninja storm 3.
each part of the story is split into sections which you can choose at any time. With different sections to choose means a different story. what i like is gone are the days of 1 to 2 hour story before each fight, now each section tells you how long it may take to play. usually 8-15 minutes for regular fights and longer for boss fights.

-online play
keep in mind everything is just first opinion and may change. The online play didnt seem to lag which is nice and the gameplay feels much more smooth. people are now allow to enter awakening and then switch to a teamate if you play team battle. This throws many spins to each fight which keep gameplay fresh. Back again are the ninja cards to customize however you want from titles to images to share with everyone and believe me there are tons of items to choose from.

in conclusion this game is great and there is much i didnt share because im still experincing the game. the changes are very nice and smooth in my opinion which makes a great fighting game. if your a fan of the series i recommend playing but be aware of tech problems until updates come out but these will be fixed.

reviewText:
Where can i even start with this game?

the Pros

The Cons
- you removed spectate mode

reviewText:
I really, really wanted to give this game a positive review. The story is great, the gameplay is fun, and there's a lot of content and replayability. But this PC port, on it's current, state is just disappointing in too many levels, and not just because of the 30 FPS lock. The game honestly is pretty smooth even with the 30 FPS lock. The major issues for me are:

- Subpar cutscenes on story mode, that are all pre rendered with a really low quality, which make them even worse than a HD version of the anime (much worse than Full Burst 3)
- Audio issues that make the sound of the voices only reproduce on the left speaker (no fix so far)
- Lack of graphics options on the menu compared to previous games, which is just inexcusable

I suppose removing the 30 FPS lock would have been nice too.
voteText: 12 of 23 people (52%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
EDIT: Alright, I'm actually gonna have to go back on my word here. I was about to refund the game when my friend recommended restarting my computer. Did so, and now the frame lag is just... gone. I still don't think the devs should be allowed to slip by on this, but I'll switch to Recommended, since the game itself is definitely awesome after the issue's fixed. Anyone who's having issues with the game's input on menus? Try restarting your computer, it just might fix the issue.

I honestly don't know what's more depressing: the fact that I was really looking forward to this game, enough to pre-order it and its Season Pass, or the fact that this game really does have the potential to be an absolutely wonderful port. It runs beautifully, the graphics are amazing, and I just got through the first Story battle, and it was amazing fun.

And y'know what's holding it back? Of all the things the developers could ♥♥♥♥ up (and ♥♥♥♥ up this horribly), it's the menus. The menus, and the graphical overlays of the animations. Y'know those situations in Ninja Storm 3 where you have quick time events for boss fights?

Imagine those, but the button prompts coming up about two seconds after you have to hit the button. The frame skips in this are absolutely brutal. I don't know what went wrong, but it's clear that I'm gonna have to vote with my wallet here, and I hope everyone else does as well.

Do not buy this game right now. Functionally, it's perfect, but I'm not going to let the devs let a problem this game-breaking slip by and keep my money. Getting a refund, figured I'd leave this here for people who read.

Don't get me wrong, my computer is pretty damn powerful. GTX 780 graphics card, fully updated drivers. Powerful processor, loads of memory and hard drive space, and I don't have a single issue running other games such as Ninja Storm 3, Revolutions, or even games where I noticed this problem before, which would be the Armed Assault series.

This is actually the first time I've ever been able to relate a Naruto game to an Armed Assault game, and that's because the intro 'sequences' (those intro credits you see, crediting each of the companies who were unlucky enough to work on this port, y'know?) are laggy as all Hell. As such, you can't even navigate through the menu without pressing the A button 5 times for it to register.

Refunding, I'm gonna wait until they patch this. If they don't, then I hope this port sinks and whoever worked on it learns a lesson from this. And that the gaming public also learns a lesson.

If a title's not up to snuff, then don't bother keeping it. Toss it back and demand something better!
