reviewText:
(This is a review of the game, not the release for PC specifically)
**Overall score is at the bottom of the review if not interested in reading the text below**

Pros:
- Very flashy movesets/QT events/ awakenings
- Quality was clearly the main goal when animating the bulk of the game
- Large character roster
- Overall, the game excels in flash

Cons:
- Each character generally has 3 combos and many of them in awakened states only have 1
- Being able to switch between characters in the team while nice doesn't justify the limited move options
- Characters feel very similar
- Adventure mode doesn't have much to keep your attention for various reasons
1) Computer players aren't the most enjoyable to play against repeatedly
2) Going from Story mode to Adventure mode is a jarring change due to the dull conversations and boring missions

- Collectables are not largely worth the effort of even getting them
- Hard to consider much of a fighter but considering all the flash and very limited movesets they never really meant it to be much of one to begin with so it is hard to really consider this a con really.
- Unless into PvP for the previous entries of games like this it is largely not worth a buy (view the story cutscenes/fights online)

Overall: If you are a fan of the manga/anime and you want to see a visual representation of the show (with revisions) then this game has a pretty good story mode. Aside from that the adventure mode isn't really worth doing and the characters largely don't have much going for them in the ways of options/customization and movesets choices. It is hard to deny however that the game has flash in spades and if PvP in the previous naruto games is your thing then this game should be a nice step up. As I have no choice but to recommend or not and have no neutral ground I will have to rate it down and hope steam eventually gives another choice between the standard like/dislike" themed options.

**6/10 For a good story mode (strays from source material often understandably) but the rest feels very lacking**

How to sum it all up: Starts off great
date: gets old fast (Best to wait till the price drops)"

reviewText:
if you enjoyed playing  revolutions you're about to love this game, it has every aspect of the online battles improved. No more annoying counter stuns, instead it works like a knockback to buy yourself some extra time .  The drive type is gone,  and so is instant awakening. Instead it's saved as a last resort once you're below 20% hp
You also have the ability to swap places with your 2 supports of your choice giving the battle much more of a dynamic feeling.

HOWEVER. the game is poorly optimized and tends to crash rather often if you like me tend to tab in and out of the game alot doing other stuffs while queing for a match.
It also have FPS drops whenever you have awakenings that give you a susano or other big particle effects and models.
Especially if your support also have big awakenins, expect atleast a 5-10 FPS drop.

it's hard to recommend this game  considering the performance issues the game has at point, but if you get the game to run smoothly it looks amazing, it feels amazing, it plays amazing.  easily the best STORM in the series.

reviewText:
Pros:
+Amazingly animated Story Mode that provides an excellent closure for the series
+Extremely flashy attacks
+Leader Change mid match spices the game up
+Easy to cancel normal strings into Team/Ultimate/Jutsu
+Linked Awakenings so you can have your entire team transform
+Unlockable costumes

Neutral:
~You can no longer give your support characters specific roles to play when filling up the storm guage; they're preset now
~Story Mode cutscenes are sometimes conveyed through still images that shake, but it's mostly during dialogue to provide context for a fight
~Bland Adventure Mode compared to the Story Mode. No flashy cutscenes and no spoken dialogue, but it does expand on character relationships a bit while exploring the ninja world

Negatives:
-Boring combat system without much diversity between characters
-New Counter system seems underwhelingly weak right now
-You can no longer buy clips of character Ultimates

PC Specific Problems As of Right Now:
-Lack of graphics options
-Only two resolutions: 720p and 1080p
-Must change the config.ini file to change V-Sync
-Story Mode cutscene dialogue only goes through the left speaker
-Not really a problem, but being 30fps locked is a little sad

reviewText:
Alright before I get started let me address the main reason there is so much hate for this game right now. The game itself isn't bad, but the optimization and graphic options are the main reason for the negativity towards Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4.

YES, it does suck that so many people are being affected by this and;
YES, CC2 should really be doing something about this.
BUT, I'll be review the game itself, not the graphical errors. (I know that it is part of the game too. I fixed my input lag, and frame drop by restarting my PC after downloading it.)

Now, for the main review:
Overall, I give this game a 8.5/10 (Rating against all other storm games) and here's why.

STORY 9/10 - The story is awesome, simply put. It closely follows the anime and manga, though there are some things that never happened (Various fights put in the game). There was screenshots of the anime that was injected into the story cinematic scenes. This really helped with making you feel like you were watching an anime. The in-game cinematic scenes were well done as well. The animations did feel like they were 'stiff' and the facial expressions were awesome as well (some kinda' look weird at some points but only very, very rarely). My only problem with the story is there was almost too much cinematics. There were several points were I was getting restless and decided just to skip ahead.

CHARACTER ROSTER 9/10 - This is their biggest roster yet, so of course it isn't bad. With that being said, I do hope they add some other characters that the community is asking for (AKA: Toneri Ōtsutsuki, Momoshiki Ōtsutsuki, and Kinshiki Ōtsutsuki). Other than that, the roster is good enough for me. EXCEPT for Adult Naruto and Adult Sasuke being DLC. *SPOILER* They are shown off for a moment at the last cut scene. Why would you put them there and then make them DLC?

MULTIPLAYER 7/10 - Now, I haven't played too much multiplayer but I would like to. Currently I have played 10 matches (won 8 lost 2) and only 3 have them have truly been enjoyable. It seems that this game suffers the same as the other Storm games. I don't know if it's just me, but it seems everyone I face (save for 3 opponents. One of which I lost too.) is playing from the very outskirts of the country with 1 bar of Wi-Fi from a McDonald's a couple miles away. The lag is God Awful and the micro-stuttering is worse. It's hard to time out your dodges, counter-attacks and attacks when you are two seconds behind the other person.

COMBAT 9.5/10 - I find this to be the most satisfying part of this game. The combat feels fast paced and flows incredibly well. The character switch is amazing and not as 'cheesy' as I thought it was initially going to be. Yes, I'm sure some players can find ways to abuse this mechanic like everything else, but I for one love it. I also really enjoy that you can switch between various ninjutsus on some characters, as well as some Ultimates on a few. The only reason I give it a 9.5/10 instead of a 10/10 is because you can't wall run. Unless I'm completely missing something, and I hope I am, the only wall running I've seen in in Story Mode. In that, it only happened 3 separate times. Why would you put this in and not put it in multiplayer or at least free battle mode?

All-in-all, awesome edition to the Storm series and a great finish. It's a shame they have optimizations problems at launch, and hopefully they fix it (doubtful but I'm hopeful).
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 is exactly what I expected: A fantastic climax to the series. I own Storm 2, Generations, Storm 3 and Revolution on my Xbox, and purchased Rev and 3 on Steam. The fighting in this runs so smooth, even locked at 30fps, every hit you land on a character really feels powerful and hell, they even edited some older characters combinations which was a nice treat. I never really noticed the 30fps, runs smooth, people get too upset on that in my opinion.

The story mode finally takes itself away from the free roaming around the Ninja land (it was seriously getting dry and annoying) and integrated it into Adventure Mode (which I have yet to try).

My first online match was super laggy even though the connection was strong which was odd.

A lot of people are having issues with the game where it runs at 1fps, last thing we need is another Batman Arkham Knight. I hope they fix that issue sooner than Warner Brothers did.

Fantastic game, cannot wait to try out every new character.


Computer Specs

AMD FX-6300 Vishera 6-Core 3.5 GHz

reviewText:
It's unfortunate to hear that so many people are having issues with the game.

I've only played a bit of the story so far and I've played a few matches, but I'm already in love. So here are my initial Pros and Cons impressions.

Pros:
+Awesome particle effects
+Great OST and SFX
+Huge roster of characters
+Beautiful art style
+Ability to switch between team members rather than just calling them in
+New loot system makes battles feel even more meaningful

Cons:
-30FPS lock (although with the cel-shading art style, I personally don't find it that noticeable)
-No V-Sync option in-game

The game really is wonderful and I hope fellow Naruto fans get to enjoy it soon! I'm sure the negative reviews will draw some attention and a fix will be in the works.

I'll update this review as I get to experience more of the game :D

reviewText: So much yes to this game...\n\nOk first off, when you start the main story it is at the last great ninja war. Believe it... Anyway, A lot of pop up command actions, a lot of O-M-F-G artful attacks and so forth. I didn't know what to expect coming into this, but jesus there is a LOT to do on this game. If you are a fan of the game and really want a large selection of characters to play, go for it. If you are looking for a Top of the line, epic fighter. Do Not Go For It. This game is great, easy to play, very beautiful in an anime sense. I give it a hard 8.5/10 for a fighting game, a 9/10 for visual sexiness and a 10/10 for all the effort and all the game play. This will be a game in which you will spend many hours playing, for either the simple battle system with A.I., Friends, or some random girl (Guy In Real Life) online battle play. Again do not go for this game because you want a hardcore fighter, Street fighter/Mortal Kombat/Hello Kitty Island Adventure are for more of your suited juggling taste. :D Good game, overall 9.1/10!

reviewText:
Man. I friggin’ love this game so much. The story is incredible, and it's delivered so well! And mechanically, it’s AMAZING! They fixed so many things, and expanded upon/balanced so many systems, and it’s all just sO MUCH FUN AAHHH!

Disclaimer: This will be very, very long. So TL;DR 10/10 Best Naruto game in existence.

For the most part I will be comparing it to Storm 3. I have Revolution, but I barely touched it as it did not continue the story.

Prior to this coming out, I binged through all of Ninja Storm 3 for the story recap, and then when I switched to this one... not only does it continue the story, but it delivers it WAAYYY better than any other Storm game. The pacing is phenomenal. They even usually save the results screens for AFTER the cutscenes, to stop from breaking pacing/immersion. As before there are a few different types of missions: Free Battles, Boss Battles, Mob Battles, etc. Many of the missions have unique mechanics, like Wall-running fights. Quick Time Events make a return, but they remain optional and reward you with a little extra back-story flavour and higher mission rankings if you do well.

There are some new mechanics that aren't just in the story! Environmental effects, and Armor Breaking. They're both fairly self-explanatory, but let me give you some examples. Kakashi has his Lightning Blade jutsu. If he charges/casts this while standing in water, the water will be electrified, and any opponents standing in it will take damage. Casting a water jutsu while tanding in water empowers it, etc. These environmental effects are only disabled for Ranked matches online. As for armor breaking, after a certain amount of damage, usually with a lot of little hits as opposed to a fewer number of stronger attacks like jutsus, the opponent's costume will take damage, and part of their outer armor/clothing will break off. This mechanic works a lot like Super Smash Bros. 4's Rage mechanic. In that game, the higher your damage, the more knock-back you'll receive on consecutive attacks. However, what's unique to SSB4, is that once you pass a certain damage threshold, your own attacks will ALSO start to deal more knockback. Storm games don't have severely important knockback mechanics like Smash, but they do have damage. When your armor is broken, you will both take and deal slightly more damage than you did before.

BUT THAT'S NOT ALL! Storm 4 is even MORE like Smash than you realize! A new feature/system are 3-round fights! We've always had 1 round fights before -- when one person's lifebar runs out, the other person wins. Now, it's like Stocks in Smash. In games like Street Fighter, the game completely resets between rounds, with only EX gauge carrying between. This is more like Smash because the survivor retains the amount of health they had when they won the first round.

That was worded weird so let me continue my Smash analogy. In SSB4, online ranked" (For Glory
recommended: it's a 1v1 match where both players have 2 stocks (read: lives) apiece. As soon as a player loses both stocks
hoursPlayed: the other one wins. Damage persists between stocks. In Ninja Storm 4
voteText: you can see a pair of Round indicators by each player's health bar. Pretending these are like Stocks in Smash makes perfect sense.\n\nDodging/Defense has some new additions. Previously
helpfulPercent: you could dodge essentially by double jumping in a certain direction. The downside of this was having to actually jump first
votesHelpful: which meant you had to do it way ahead of time due to the startup. Now you can hold the guard button and you'll immediately dodge in the direction you move
votesTotal: making it very much like Super Smash Bros. (Which is a very good thing)! Additionally
votesFunny: there is now a Counter/Parry mechanic. While you're guarding if you hit X/Square at the moment you are attacked
commentsCount: you'll cancel out of their attack and push your opponent far away from you
column16: at the cost of temporarily reducing your maximum chakra. This cost is incurred whether successful or not.\n\nAssists! "Team" matches that actually emphasize the "TEAM"! On the Character Select Screen
column17: you can see a small icon in the top left corner of their character portrait. This icon indicates which kind of Support action that character has. In the past
column18: all characters could be Attack
column20: or Balance style of assists. Now
column21: there are a bunch of kinds.\n\nStrikeback: after knock back
column22: opponent bounces back before your feet
column23: allows you to extend your combo or UJ.\nCover Fire: if you use chakra shuriken
column24:
your support will too
Carge Assist: Allows you to charge chakra faster
Break Guard: Support assist you with combos while attacking
Charge Guard: Support covers you while charging chakra
Secret Technique Substitute: Support will take a super for you
column25: if it would have hit you\nDash Cut: Support will cover you
column26:
when the opponent dashes at you

Every character with their own slot on the CSS always has just a single one of these. These Support abilities start to activate when your Storm gauge is at least halfway full.

Oh yeah
column27: the Storm Gauge! This is like the old Team Gauge in the top left. It now sits below your Chakra gauge towards the middle. It fills up as you take damage
column29: and as you call in your assists to attack. They also fill as you SWITCH LEADERS MID COMBO! You heard me right
column30: folks~! Picking your 3 character team means picking THREE CHARACTERS TO PLAY AS! And NOT just a character with 2 assists!\n\nSo each assist's portrait fills up over time after you use it. In-game this is referred to as the Assist Gauge. Switching leaders consumes only HALF of the cooldown of an assist. You can switch characters mid-combo by moving the Right analog stick in the direction (Left/Right) of the assist in the corner. E.g.
column32: and Sakura was LB and Sasuke was RB

reviewText:
I ran the game 3 times so far.

1st time - crashed immediately after the intro, had to play it again.
2nd time - crashed while I was starting the first mission. I was able to keep my progress this time.
3rd time - crashed after I finished 3 missions and switched windows (I was in fullscreen mode)

While it is really easy to really rage and act like a child about the hiccups this game is getting, there are a few things to keep in mind.

1. We are PC Master Race. We get way more options but it isn't like we aren't used to hiccups like this. That's why we are better, we understand what comes with the platform. When they fix this game, it will run flawlessly. Which leads me to #2.
2. This is the first day the game came out. From what I can remember, it is the first time this released along-side the console releases. My local Gamestop told me I can't even get my copy until tuesday (2-9-2016). I am under the impression this game came out even before the console versions this time around. They can get around to patching it, it will be a very good game.

In it's current state (Day 1), I cannot recommend it for the crashing. Check back in the a week though because:

3. Within 10 minutes of playing, it is hands down the best Ultimate Ninja Storm game to come out since the original. I think that says a lot.

reviewText:
if you enjoyed playing  revolutions you're about to love this game, it has every aspect of the online battles improved. No more annoying counter stuns, instead it works like a knockback to buy yourself some extra time .  The drive type is gone,  and so is instant awakening. Instead it's saved as a last resort once you're below 20% hp
You also have the ability to swap places with your 2 supports of your choice giving the battle much more of a dynamic feeling.

HOWEVER. the game is poorly optimized and tends to crash rather often if you like me tend to tab in and out of the game alot doing other stuffs while queing for a match.
It also have FPS drops whenever you have awakenings that give you a susano or other big particle effects and models.
Especially if your support also have big awakenins, expect atleast a 5-10 FPS drop.

it's hard to recommend this game  considering the performance issues the game has at point, but if you get the game to run smoothly it looks amazing, it feels amazing, it plays amazing.  easily the best STORM in the series.

reviewText:
Pros:
+Amazingly animated Story Mode that provides an excellent closure for the series
+Extremely flashy attacks
+Leader Change mid match spices the game up
+Easy to cancel normal strings into Team/Ultimate/Jutsu
+Linked Awakenings so you can have your entire team transform
+Unlockable costumes

Neutral:
~You can no longer give your support characters specific roles to play when filling up the storm guage; they're preset now
~Story Mode cutscenes are sometimes conveyed through still images that shake, but it's mostly during dialogue to provide context for a fight
~Bland Adventure Mode compared to the Story Mode. No flashy cutscenes and no spoken dialogue, but it does expand on character relationships a bit while exploring the ninja world

Negatives:
-Boring combat system without much diversity between characters
-New Counter system seems underwhelingly weak right now
-You can no longer buy clips of character Ultimates

PC Specific Problems As of Right Now:
-Lack of graphics options
-Only two resolutions: 720p and 1080p
-Must change the config.ini file to change V-Sync
-Story Mode cutscene dialogue only goes through the left speaker
-Not really a problem, but being 30fps locked is a little sad

reviewText:
Truly a great final installement in the STORM series. Fantastic graphics, amazingly presented story mode, bringing us right to the conclusion of the Naruto story, tonns of content, new battle mechanics allowing for longer and more immersive battles, with a functioning online mode which is comfortable to use as you can play free battles whilst waiting for the opponent. The soundtrack is, as usual, stunning. The new mechanics bear intelligence in their implementation which, as I can clearly see, is going to keep me at play for so much longer. The season pass content seems to exceed expectation and keep the game fresh and give even more ground to be excited for in the future.
I have not experienced any technical issues with the game, and thus will not subtract any marks from the game for that. Loadings are few and very quick.
An epic conclusion worthy of the manga series.
10/10.

reviewText:
Alright before I get started let me address the main reason there is so much hate for this game right now. The game itself isn't bad, but the optimization and graphic options are the main reason for the negativity towards Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4.

YES, it does suck that so many people are being affected by this and;
YES, CC2 should really be doing something about this.
BUT, I'll be review the game itself, not the graphical errors. (I know that it is part of the game too. I fixed my input lag, and frame drop by restarting my PC after downloading it.)

Now, for the main review:
Overall, I give this game a 8.5/10 (Rating against all other storm games) and here's why.

STORY 9/10 - The story is awesome, simply put. It closely follows the anime and manga, though there are some things that never happened (Various fights put in the game). There was screenshots of the anime that was injected into the story cinematic scenes. This really helped with making you feel like you were watching an anime. The in-game cinematic scenes were well done as well. The animations did feel like they were 'stiff' and the facial expressions were awesome as well (some kinda' look weird at some points but only very, very rarely). My only problem with the story is there was almost too much cinematics. There were several points were I was getting restless and decided just to skip ahead.

CHARACTER ROSTER 9/10 - This is their biggest roster yet, so of course it isn't bad. With that being said, I do hope they add some other characters that the community is asking for (AKA: Toneri Ōtsutsuki, Momoshiki Ōtsutsuki, and Kinshiki Ōtsutsuki). Other than that, the roster is good enough for me. EXCEPT for Adult Naruto and Adult Sasuke being DLC. *SPOILER* They are shown off for a moment at the last cut scene. Why would you put them there and then make them DLC?

MULTIPLAYER 7/10 - Now, I haven't played too much multiplayer but I would like to. Currently I have played 10 matches (won 8 lost 2) and only 3 have them have truly been enjoyable. It seems that this game suffers the same as the other Storm games. I don't know if it's just me, but it seems everyone I face (save for 3 opponents. One of which I lost too.) is playing from the very outskirts of the country with 1 bar of Wi-Fi from a McDonald's a couple miles away. The lag is God Awful and the micro-stuttering is worse. It's hard to time out your dodges, counter-attacks and attacks when you are two seconds behind the other person.

COMBAT 9.5/10 - I find this to be the most satisfying part of this game. The combat feels fast paced and flows incredibly well. The character switch is amazing and not as 'cheesy' as I thought it was initially going to be. Yes, I'm sure some players can find ways to abuse this mechanic like everything else, but I for one love it. I also really enjoy that you can switch between various ninjutsus on some characters, as well as some Ultimates on a few. The only reason I give it a 9.5/10 instead of a 10/10 is because you can't wall run. Unless I'm completely missing something, and I hope I am, the only wall running I've seen in in Story Mode. In that, it only happened 3 separate times. Why would you put this in and not put it in multiplayer or at least free battle mode?

All-in-all, awesome edition to the Storm series and a great finish. It's a shame they have optimizations problems at launch, and hopefully they fix it (doubtful but I'm hopeful).

reviewText:
Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 is exactly what I expected: A fantastic climax to the series. I own Storm 2, Generations, Storm 3 and Revolution on my Xbox, and purchased Rev and 3 on Steam. A lot of people are having issues with the game where it runs at 1fps, last thing we need is another Batman Arkham Knight. I hope they fix that issue sooner than Warner Brothers did.

Fantastic game, cannot wait to try out every new character.

reviewText:
Truly a great final installement in the STORM series. Fantastic graphics, amazingly presented story mode, bringing us right to the conclusion of the Naruto story, tonns of content, new battle mechanics allowing for longer and more immersive battles, with a functioning online mode which is comfortable to use as you can play free battles whilst waiting for the opponent. The soundtrack is, as usual, stunning. The new mechanics bear intelligence in their implementation which, as I can clearly see, is going to keep me at play for so much longer. The season pass content seems to exceed expectation and keep the game fresh and give even more ground to be excited for in the future.
I have not experienced any technical issues with the game, and thus will not subtract any marks from the game for that. Loadings are few and very quick.
An epic conclusion worthy of the manga series.
10/10.

reviewText:
Alright before I get started let me address the main reason there is so much hate for this game right now. The game itself isn't bad, but the optimization and graphic options are the main reason for the negativity towards Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4.

YES, it does suck that so many people are being affected by this and;
YES, CC2 should really be doing something about this.
BUT, I'll be review the game itself, not the graphical errors. (I know that it is part of the game too. I fixed my input lag, and frame drop by restarting my PC after downloading it.)

Now, for the main review:
Overall, I give this game a 8.5/10 (Rating against all other storm games) and here's why.

STORY 9/10 - The story is awesome, simply put. It closely follows the anime and manga, though there are some things that never happened (Various fights put in the game). There was screenshots of the anime that was injected into the story cinematic scenes. This really helped with making you feel like you were watching an anime. The in-game cinematic scenes were well done as well. The animations did feel like they were 'stiff' and the facial expressions were awesome as well (some kinda' look weird at some points but only very, very rarely). My only problem with the story is there was almost too much cinematics. There were several points were I was getting restless and decided just to skip ahead.

CHARACTER ROSTER 9/10 - This is their biggest roster yet, so of course it isn't bad. With that being said, I do hope they add some other characters that the community is asking for (AKA: Toneri Ōtsutsuki, Momoshiki Ōtsutsuki, and Kinshiki Ōtsutsuki). Other than that, the roster is good enough for me. EXCEPT for Adult Naruto and Adult Sasuke being DLC. *SPOILER* They are shown off for a moment at the last cut scene. Why would you put them there and then make them DLC?

MULTIPLAYER 7/10 - Now, I haven't played too much multiplayer but I would like to. Currently I have played 10 matches (won 8 lost 2) and only 3 have them have truly been enjoyable. It seems that this game suffers the same as the other Storm games. I don't know if it's just me, but it seems everyone I face (save for 3 opponents. One of which I lost too.) is playing from the very outskirts of the country with 1 bar of Wi-Fi from a McDonald's a couple miles away. The lag is God Awful and the micro-stuttering is worse. It's hard to time out your dodges, counter-attacks and attacks when you are two seconds behind the other person.

COMBAT 9.5/10 - I find this to be the most satisfying part of this game. The combat feels fast paced and flows incredibly well. The character switch is amazing and not as 'cheesy' as I thought it was initially going to be. Yes, I'm sure some players can find ways to abuse this mechanic like everything else, but I for one love it. I also really enjoy that you can switch between various ninjutsus on some characters, as well as some Ultimates on a few. The only reason I give it a 9.5/10 instead of a 10/10 is because you can't wall run. Unless I'm completely missing something, and I hope I am, the only wall running I've seen in in Story Mode. In that, it only happened 3 separate times. Why would you put this in and not put it in multiplayer or at least free battle mode?

All-in-all, awesome edition to the Storm series and a great finish. It's a shame they have optimizations problems at launch, and hopefully they fix it (doubtful but I'm hopeful).

reviewText:
I ran the game 3 times so far.

1st time - crashed immediately after the intro, had to play it again.
2nd time - crashed while I was starting the first mission. I was able to keep my progress this time.
3rd time - crashed after I finished 3 missions and switched windows (I was in fullscreen mode)

While it is really easy to really rage and act like a child about the hiccups this game is getting, there are a few things to keep in mind.

1. We are PC Master Race. We get way more options but it isn't like we aren't used to hiccups like this. That's why we are better, we understand what comes with the platform. When they fix this game, it will run flawlessly. Which leads me to #2.
2. This is the first day the game came out. From what I can remember, it is the first time this released along-side the console releases. My local Gamestop told me I can't even get my copy until tuesday (2-9-2016). I am under the impression this game came out even before the console versions this time around. They can get around to patching it, it will be a very good game.

In it's current state (Day 1), I cannot recommend it for the crashing. Check back in the a week though because:

3. Within 10 minutes of playing, it is hands down the best Ultimate Ninja Storm game to come out since the original. I think that says a lot.

reviewText:
if you enjoyed playing  revolutions you're about to love this game, it has every aspect of the online battles improved. No more annoying counter stuns, instead it works like a knockback to buy yourself some extra time .  The drive type is gone,  and so is instant awakening. Instead it's saved as a last resort once you're below 20% hp
You also have the ability to swap places with your 2 supports of your choice giving the battle much more of a dynamic feeling.

HOWEVER. the game is poorly optimized and tends to crash rather often if you like me tend to tab in and out of the game alot doing other stuffs while queing for a match.
It also have FPS drops whenever you have awakenings that give you a susano or other big particle effects and models.
Especially if your support also have big awakenins, expect atleast a 5-10 FPS drop.

it's hard to recommend this game  considering the performance issues the game has at point, but if you get the game to run smoothly it looks amazing, it feels amazing, it plays amazing.  easily the best STORM in the series.

reviewText:
Pros:
+Amazingly animated Story Mode that provides an excellent closure for the series
+Extremely flashy attacks
+Leader Change mid match spices the game up
+Easy to cancel normal strings into Team/Ultimate/Jutsu
+Linked Awakenings so you can have your entire team transform
+Unlockable costumes

Neutral:
~You can no longer give your support characters specific roles to play when filling up the storm guage; they're preset now
~Story Mode cutscenes are sometimes conveyed through still images that shake, but it's mostly during dialogue to provide context for a fight
~Bland Adventure Mode compared to the Story Mode. No flashy cutscenes and no spoken dialogue, but it does expand on character relationships a bit while exploring the ninja world

Negatives:
-Boring combat system without much diversity between characters
-New Counter system seems underwhelingly weak right now
-You can no longer buy clips of character Ultimates

PC Specific Problems As of Right Now:
-Lack of graphics options
-Only two resolutions: 720p and 1080p
-Must change the config.ini file to change V-Sync
-Story Mode cutscene dialogue only goes through the left speaker
-Not really a problem, but being 30fps locked is a little sad

reviewText:
Completed the whole story within 9-10 hours. Animation wise and gameplay wise, this is the best Storm game I've played so far. Definitely worth the money.
For those that have read the manga and know how everything ends, you will be astonished by the beauty of the animation. Gameplay speaks for itself if you have played the other Storm games.
Still have yet to try Adventure mode and Online battles, looks very promising.
No fillers whatsoever, which was surprisingly great.
People that are complaining about the game being slow or bad, you are the only reason why it doesn't work. Get a better PC. I have had no issue at all with anything. No stutters, no FPS drops, nothing.
PC Specs :
MSI R9 280 GAMING 3G
Intel Core i5 4460 / 3.2 Ghz - 6 MB cache
Crucial Ballistix Tactical 8 GB
MSI H81M-E35 - Moederbord - micro ATX

Only downside however, is that there are 2 resolution options : 1920x1080 and 1280x720. Not a problem for me but might be for others.
Once again, I recommend this game for any Naruto fan. Seriously worth the money. It is also the last Storm, you don't want to miss out on that.

Oh, and also someting useful right here if you open up the game for the first time, here are the controls :
Options : Press O on your keyboard
A Button : Press L on your keyboard
B Button : Press Plus Sign/Equal Sign on your keyboard
Keyboard Settings : Press Backspace on your keyboard.

By the way, I played the game with my Playstation 3 controller. If you need a tutorial, leave a comment below.

reviewText: I pre-ordered the game and after I got in minute 1 I started playing it. After quite a few fantastic hous with no tehnical problems, I was courious to see the reviews for the game. I am a Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm fanatic (these games are the main the reason why I bought my PS3 in the first place) and I couldn't believe to see that the overal score for the games in 52% mixed... After I read the reviews I understood that there are tehnical problems, fps related ones that affect other people's performance. Myself, not a single problem this far, so I want to say to everyone to give this game a shot. It's fantastic! The graphics, the music, the roster of characters, the story, the boss battles and many other great features exist in this game. I also saw that some people told that they completed the story in less than 5 hours. Well, the story may not be very long, but it is the longest in the entire franchise with many great battles to enjoy. With the cutscenes which are loyal to the anime, the story lasts more the 5 hours. And then you have a lot of things to do if you want to get all the achivements. (replay story battles, tournaments, league, survival) You will get your money's worth, believe me.

reviewText:
I'm gonna keep this review short: basically, this game is what to be expected of an entry in the Storm series - a bunch of new characters, campaign that goes from the last storm game to the end of the series, some revamped graphics and some mechanics that change the meta-game entirely.

PROs:

- The graphics - the new particle effects and models look absolutely gorgeous, way better than anything previous game have come up with.
- Leader swapping - This is what should have been implemented in the Storm games a long time ago.
- The story mode.
- Armor destruction and element effects.
- Online doesn't have the issues it had in previous installments.
- A pretty big chunk of content.

CONs:

- 30 fps. Seriously, devs, this is a 2016 PC game. This has absolutely no excuse. The good thing is that the game is fluent enough that it doesn't feel like other 30 fps games.
- Graphical issues for some AMD cards and stuff, will be fixed by patches and stuff.
- The removal of support characters instead of fleshing them out as playable. This is the last Storm game and we still don't have Kurenai and Anko as playable characters - what the hell?
- Toxic online community. Expect ragequits, spamming Deidara+Tobi combos and angry russians shouting at you in Russian.

Also, the initial bad reviews this game has were due to people trying to play it on their integrated graphics cards and GT 620s and also due to the legitimate optimization issues it had on some goods cards. I've been running it on a GTX 660 and I've encountered no frame-drops whatsoever - solid 30 fps everytime.

Hi Guys!

Finally i think i've got the cure for all of our problems:
So,i bought this game and i really wanted to play it, but when i opened up the game I was screwed up. I searched for an answear to my problem,but nothing worked.
I stayed with the game in library 1 week,but then i finally got it...

So if you've got an laptop with a resolution of 1920x1080 you're game will not work. So you need to setup your resolution at 1280x720. This will not completly escape you from lag. You need to set off every thing from SHADOW, GLARE,and the other things at off or in shadow case, low.


For me worked, and I finally escaped of lag and now i can play the game with pleasure!

reviewText:
I have owned a Naruto Ultimate Ninja game from CyberConnect2 since its Playstation 2 days and down to the Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolution in PS3. Now I have bought Naruto UNS 4 and what could i say? - Impressive.

The developers were able to capture the look and feel of what Naruto and it's world has brought to us and even closes the story of Naruto itself as opposed to the anime (though they've taken some liberty in its representation, I would say they were still able to capture what's needed from the story).

Cons:
- A number of characters are currently unavailable in this iteration (but I think they'll become available via DLC so no worries about that)
- Online lag - since the game (on PC) reverts to peer to peer connection i rarely find myself without lag (which is a complete bummer if you want to play online)

I have seen a number of reviews talking about problems with crashing and lagging - this has not happened to me at all, both in my Windows 8.1 desktop and Windows 10 laptop. Take a look at the specs/requirements and see if your machine could handle it.


Pros:
- Good story, captures the essence and closes the Naruto story
- Great gameplay - I have seriously never had a problem with gameplay since the first iterations of the game, it's a good mix of strategy and fun. I usually play offline or with friends and it's extremely fun
- Graphics is great

reviewText: I both love and hate Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4. As a fan of the anime and manga, I expected lots of intense action from what’s been presented as the final game of the Ultimate Ninja Storm series, and to its credit, Storm 4 delivers. The characters and over-the-top battles look and feel great, and the story pays off in a satisfying way. On the other hand, even the best combat system in the world would be wasted if there are no worthy opponents to be found.\n\nThat's not to say that this combat is the best, but it is pretty strong. Fights are fast and fierce, and are treated like major events by way of plenty of cinematic camera angles and powerful jutsu moves at your disposal. The controls are simple and the most responsive of the Storm games to date. What I liked most, however, was the ability to switch between your active fighter and two support characters on the fly by moving the right analog stick. This let me use my characters for both active and support roles, and didn’t limit them to one task in a fight. In one battle, I was able launch a series of punches with Hinata before calling for an assist from Naruto to deal more damage, and then switching to Hashirama Senju to recharge my energy fast for a  follow-up jutsu attack.

reviewText: I liked the game, as a Naruto fan. The game boasts a huge roster of character with unique move sets which are almost exactly like the animation and managa Naruto's. The gameplay is fun, but simplistic relative to other fighting genres.\n\nOverall, i'd recommend the game to Naruto fans of all skill levels, as the fighting system isn't complex enough to be considered difficult.

reviewText:
Here are my pros and cons, but you should know ahead of time that I don't have much experience with these types of games. I have never played games like mortal kombat or street fighter. The only similar games I have played are Budokai (a DBZ version of this game) and Soul Caliber. So compared to those, I found this one far more enjoyable.


PROS
____
The game's combat is intense and fun, even sorta tactical compared to games like budokai which is just non-stop spamming the hit button till your opponent is dead.

A LOT of characters to choose from, over 100 in all, and each have different abilities you have to pick from to go into battle with, which makes planning ahead of time and careful customization very important.

You can do single 1v1 battles, or 1v2, 1v3, 2v2, 2v3, etc. Letting you mix and match your favorite characters from the show.



CONS
____
The game's story mode is FAR too short for a $50 game. So if you are hoping to get invested into a good story for a few days or weeks/months, then this is the wrong game. This game is simply intended for passing time, and is something you probably wont sit down in a single session for more than 3-4 hours at a time.

I personally felt like some of the characters need tweaking as they are underpowered vs main characters, but this could be simply because I don't understand how to correctly play them.

I felt like some of the animations could have been better, but this is subjective.

reviewText:
I usually disregard negative reviews that are due to compatibility issues since I keep my desktop in good condition, and I never have suffered compatibility issues myself. This game however, really doesn't run properly. On a fresh install of Windows 10 on a fast desktop, this game crashed frequently, stopping me from getting past the prologue in the story.

If you are purchasing this game, look up Steam's refund policy and make sure to test the game within the time limit. It's a fun game, so good luck!

TL;DR
For the bits I was able to play, I had a lot of fun, and recommend this game if not for the compatibility issues.

reviewText:
UPDATED REVIEW AGAIN (2/13/2016):
Bandai Namco dropped us a patch that fixed most of the bugs people were encountering and are investigating the Save File Corruption error that people are apparently getting. Looks like they also finally got some moderators for the Steam discussions as well.

If the game still runs at lower than 30fps for you, you can always download the mod Tormunds made even though it's for the older version of this game. If you want to play with anyone you will also have to send them that mod as well. You can always rename NSUNS4.exe to keep the old EXE so you don't have to re-verify your cache every time.

After about a week, everything seems to be sorted out finally.

Now onto the actual review:

Graphics - 9.5/10
Beautiful 3D Animu graphics. Definitely an upgrade compared to previous games with the models. They also added in more particle effects and armor/weapon breaks as well. Finally the fanboys can take off the female casts' clothes by playing the game! (Oh yeah, and the fire ballz look better. If you're into that I guess.)

Sound - 7/10
Sound effects are not really that different, but they added/changed a few here and there. Whenever you have the quality set too high in the sound driver manager, the audio becomes ♥♥♥♥. So yeah. Don't do that. (And sometimes it's set to a higher setting as default. Just use 44100Hz.) They fixed the bug that made my right ear feel alone. He finally has a friend!

Gameplay - 8.5/10
They added more gameplay to this game overall. You can now actually use your supports as regular characters or use them as backups without having to change anything. They also added a new 3-round system that can make a salty loser stop talking ♥♥♥♥.

Online - 9/10
The network mode is Peer to Peer connections, so the match is dependent on both players and there's no middle-man server to stop either of you. I haven't personally used the match-making because I don't like to fight randoms, but I heard it got better by a bit. The only time it will lag when both people use a good connection is if one of them is experiencing FPS drops. Nothing irregular here. (And stop ♥♥♥♥♥ing about input lag when you're a red bar pls. Also turn off your mics pls.)

Replayability - 10/10
There's a lot to do in this game. You have the 5-hour long story mode, adventure mode, and a whole bunch of Free Battle/Online modes to play with. With a cast of over 100 characters and a large amount of stages, there's a lot to experiment with if you're like me and love to play as all of the characters. Also it's just ♥♥♥♥ing fun so y'know that works too.

reviewText:
update:
Many of the bad reviews you see are from the initial release where many people had performance issues and haven't bothered to change them, I never ran into these issues and I am not using a very powerful PC at all. (phenom 3 with an unlocked 4th core and a 7950). The game never has any fps drops for me, there can be stuttering in multiplayer though. This is because the game doesn't use servers but a peer-to-peer connection, meaning both players basically are hosting so if one has terrible internet both players suffer, luckily you can see the other players connection before you start a match (even with ranked mode) so you can just decide to not play with people with a bad connection. There is also the issue of not being able to mute the mics of other players, which is very unfortunate. Even with these thing the game is still a blast and I totally recommend it.

original review:
Right off the bat you may notice that many reviews are complaining about the 30 fps cap, while I agree that it sucks I will say its a good 30fps, let me explain. Frame times are really good for such a low framerate and its a steady output, which means input lag is very low and the way the animations are put together it appears much smoother than it is. This coming from a guy who thinks anything less than 140fps in CS:GO is a failure. the gameplay feels fluid despite the cap and its lots of fun overall and differs a lot from other fighting games. The battles are skill based and feel epic and fast paced, there's is a lot of variety in gameplay and characters, but the story mode starts late in the storyline so if you aren't familiar with the Naruto storyline you will be completely lost in story mode. The game is a lot of fun, and I totally recommend it.

I will admit there is a bit of a learning curve if you aren't into that kind of thing, but Its an overall great game I rate it 9/10, definately worth every penny and I would buy it again.

reviewText:
有树叶飞舞的地方，火就会燃烧

这是个粉丝向的游戏，火影死忠必买不解释，但如果你只是一个喜欢格斗游戏的玩家，那么单纯从游戏性的角度来看，这款游戏其实并不算好，角色能力差异不平衡，而且套路招式大多沿用了上作，本作新招式不是特别多，故事模式中过场动画用了好多tv版动画，还特么是不动的连环画，略有点坑，几十G的大小照理说完全可以做成即时动画，还有厂商是呲屎了的万代，如果你能接受以上几点瑕疵的话接着看。

讲完缺点讲讲好的地方，本作无论画质还是打击感和操作感都比较好，虽然qte挺单调，玩起来还是挺爽的，至于剧情，大致上忠于原著，贴近漫画，虽然用了很多tv版的连环画，好歹没有那么多无关故事主线的tv组的原创回忆来打乱节奏，所以一口气打通关吧你这个吊车尾！

最重要的还是情怀，然后宁次你死得好惨，我们不会忘记你，最后火影无论是动画还是剧场版看了这么些年也没花过一毛钱，这70刀也算是为自己的青春补上票钱吧。

私はうずまきナルト,私は火影になる

reviewText:
THIS REVIEW HAS BEEN REWRITTEN! TWICE!

TL;DR - They Fixed It! Its Great!

Good Job, CC2

I had once written a review NOT Recommending this game .

But...

CyberConnect 2 / Namco Bandai listened to the Steam Community (and Twitter) and actually fixed this game!
The Only problem that this game has now is the Static Noises bug! (Oh and the somewhat crappy Netcode stil)

This game is great! The Story Mode finishes the NARUTO SHIPPUDEN Storyline and even has a Adventure Mode for after the Main Story

Free Battles are like Normal but add a few new things like being able to change leaders during battle, Armor Breaks to lower enemy defenses, and Elements actually affecting battles! (Try using a Water Style user on Water).

and finally Online Battles...

They are pretty much the same as the other STORM games.

This game adds a few new playable characters and much better graphics than the other STORM games.

I give this game 9.5 / 10

Also to anyone that is having performance issues there is a thread on the Community Hub for this game where someone modded the .exe for this game and removed shadows and particle effects. The custom exe does work and I still continue to use it!

(Edit: The Custom .exe does not work anymore. You need to do it yourself using an Hex Editor. There are some Videos out there that teach you how to do it.)

reviewText: I'm putting my review on not recommended to get peoples attention on the problems, first of all, I see the complaints of a 30fps cap, really guys? Complaining over 30fps? Every naruto game even the consoles are 30fps, and who cares about the frame drop? I'm sure everyone gets the frame drop every so often, and I see a complaint on crashes also, luckily, I have a fix for you windows 10 users, just find the application in your programs x86, find steam, open it and find steamapps, go to common and go to naruto storm 4, right click the program to launch the game and go to properties, go to compatibility and change the compatibility to windows 7, I think this only fixes the crash for windows 10 users, but it might help the others also, and if you have NVIDIA, go to the control panel and go to manage 3D settings, now I don't know if you guys have it but in global settings, it says like preferred graphics processer, I don't have it but if you DO have it, change it to High Performance GPU, and also in the drop down table in global settings, find vertical sync and turn it on, this will work for Nvidia users only, but how I fixed my crashes was to only change the compatibility to windows 7. and if you have the minimum requirements for the game, guys, don't assume that you're going to run at the best performance, that just means that the game is playable for you. Hope this helps.\n\nUPDATE: About 9 hours I made this review, I found out how to fix the sound, go to your playback devices and find your main speaker and then in the advanced tab, go change it to 48000.

reviewText:
DISCLAIMER: I AM A NARUTO FAN SO THIS REVIEW MAY BE BIASED
Pros:
Does a good job in restoring the Naruto plotline
Smooth battle/QTE events(at least I think its cool)
Nice BGM
Wraps up the plotline

Cons:
Had horrible fps when I initially launched the game(around 10), and it was launched in windowed mode, I hade to go to the in game configs to switch to fullscreen
A good portion of the plotline was made of images instead of real-model animation, which was a huge disappointment, and for some reason I can only hear character's voice from just one side of my headset



P.S. For all those Nvidia people out there suffering w/ 10- fps, here is a solution I found: Open Nvidia Control Panel then go to Manage 3D settings, then select the Program Settings tab. In the tab, Press the ADD icon and find UNS4, then in the dropdown menu, select High-performance NVIDIA processor. This solution worked for me so far, and dispite the 30fps everone has been complaining, I dont really see a difference, as I am using a laptop (GTX 870).

Edit: the QTE is flawed in terms of its scoring system, sometimes I can almost press it at the last moment and getting a 4 star, and sometimes even when I pressed it at like the middle it gives me a 2 star

reviewText:
----Rant below about the current reviews----
So most reviews are negative for dumb launch issues or salty people that wanted 60FPS absolutely. In my opinion if you really wanted to play this, the FPS wouldn't matter. Even though I would've liked 60FPS too, 30FPS is perfectly playabe.

Yes it's 30FPS, just like every other Storm games. It doesn't hinder the gameplay or the story. The low framerates issue that people are having are probably due to their rig. I've been running this for 7 hours with a solid 30FPS.

----Actual review----

Now for the actual game, I've been only playing the story so far. In my opinion it's much better than in Storm 3, instead of going through pointless adventure and eventually get some story fights, it's just a timeline that follows the actual end of the Shippuuden story. I also feel that they managed to re-create the content really well.

I'm about 75% in the story currently, the fights so far were really awesome and the visual effects were stunning. The combat feels responsive and feels the best out of all the Storm games.

The soundtrack is as good as ever, fit the mood perfectly during cut-scenes or fights.

I will update this later once I get to play the adventure mode and the online mode.

reviewText:
It's definitly a step up from the past storm games.
The only problem I have personally had was voice audio being left channel only, and in free battle my matches would start at 10-20 fps, but then will go back to 30 fps after a good second.

Speaking of fps, seems it's locked at 30 fps, but playing all the past games, this does not bother me and I have already adapted to this fps because of the past games.

EDIT:

The Feb 12 patch fixed all the above problems for me, so now I would fully recommend this game to any naruto and fighting game fan, granted you ment the system requirements.

My specs:

CPU: i5-4570 overclocked @ 3.55 Ghz
memory: 8 GB DDR3

reviewText: This review is for those that can run the game without issues such as the lag and stuttering.   Overall the game works just fine, but this is the PC platform so expectations are higher.  Plays just as well if not better than the PS4 demo and the Storm games have always been 30fps so it wasn't a deal breaker for me and it seems the gameplay is built around this anyway.  Looks great to me, but I realize that this is a fighting game and I don't expect super intense environmental detail and all sorts of other fancy effects.  I'd say it's a decent port if you can run it, if not then you can always refund it.

reviewText:
Very Early Review, many things may be changed afterwhich, but regardless I am 100% positive that I will always love this game, also I came in expecting good things and I got what I wanted, but I never had a big focus on settings which at this current time of the review seem too few for more setting-focused minds.

Positives:

* This game is quite fun
* The story mode is epic and I haven't gone through four story missions yet (free battle is too hard for me to quit)
* The new characters Boruto and Sarada are addictive to play especially together as intended
* The characters in this have been quite buffed and elemental environment effects add many volumes to the game for      tactics

Negatives:
* The settings are meh, it doesn't give too many options to fiddle with

reviewText:
No problems for me. The game is amazing as it is and almost everything is good about it.
Now, let's go right to the negative parts.
Some of the cutscenes aren't animated and the game feels a lot easier than previous chapters.
The adventure mode is meh and the online mode is a bit unbalanced (I hope they patch it).
There is a FPS lock to 30 too, which is nor good, nor bad. It works, for this game.
I think you should buy it, as the game is going to be patched soon to mitigate the problems it has (I haven't had problems with the game stability as some other people may have experienced thought)

reviewText:
I recommend this fully to evry naruto fans out there even if you're not a naruto fan you'll find yourself enjoying this game because this is a fantastic fighthing game with over 100+ different characters to play with and with!The gameplay is the for me the best out of the series because it's fast awesome looking and you feel like a boss when you do combos!For you're hardcore fighting game lovers out there this game doesn't disapoint a that section either because there is some huge learning curve to do!For casuel you'll find this pretty enjoyable too because attacking and combos are pretty simple to land and to do!

Gameplay:
-You have substitue to get out off combos
-Chakra gauge use to do powerful move's or a tool to get closer,away or a combos extender
-You have 8 buttons 1 for normal attack,1 for projectiles,1 for chakra,2 for support,1 for substitue,1 for shield,1 for dash
-For me its 60fps but i heard thats its 30fps lock so dont ask me
-Looks beautiful looking alot like the anime and gets even better when you land ultimate justu or a justu
-Can switch characters at all time's between you're support

Content:
-You have you're story mode wich goes to the ten tails summon to the end of Naruto
-You have you're freeplay and online mode
-You have a side story call adventure mode wich is fun little continuation of the story but it's mostly a opperation to make Naruto like Hinata alot more
-You have tuns of collectibles for characters and you're ninja card(online only)
-Customization for character like: wich move they use, a special end cutscene(only appears when you kill someone with a Ultimate justu) and change you're substitue to a log to a doll


Cons:
-Like evry fighting game ever you have you're bad characters and you're good one's
-Sometime's it can get a little repetive but that never annoyed me

Final score's: 8.5 or 9/10 I am a naruto fan so that might a help the score a little bit but this game is Fun like any fighting games out there it's complex and yet simple and easy to play!I had a great time and im gonna keep on playing this for a while

reviewText:
TL;DR in the end.
I just finished the story mode of the game, played a few free battles and some more online battles, and with that I must say that this game is extraordinary!
Such a great addition to the Storm series.
What are you saying? This game has 50% of positive reviews and I'm say that it is an excellent game?
Let me tell you something mate, you see all of those negative reviews? 40% of them are people complaining that this games does not run at 60fps, other 40% are complaining about slowndowns.
20% are complaining about the game itself.
Now...About the 60fps issue"... The game runs at 30 fps. Is that an issue? No
date: moving on.\nSlowdowns... Why do they happen? Because your pc lacks the horsepower for this game.\nMy game runs at perfect 30 fps
recommended: it only drops to 20/15 fps when the screen splits to show more than one character (Team Awakening
hoursPlayed: Some ultimate jutsus and some Boss cutscenes. You know why I don't complain about these slowdowns? If I disable some graphical options (Low Shadows
voteText: Motion blur etc)

so basically it's not the game that has a problem.

TL;DR
This game is amazing

The story mode is good, but I do think they skip some important things in it. Some of the cutscenes looked low quailty because they were basically just taken out from the anime, though the cgi cutscenes looked really good!
The adventure mode seems decent but nothing special.
The multiplayer is what keeps me playing this game, it's so satisfying defeating someone who's good at the game, but there's quite a lot who have not the best net or just spam, which can destory the fun sometimes.
I love the new figthing methods but some can be abused.


Some things I don't like is that
The connection in online is really ♥♥♥♥.
The game is locked at 30 fps.
You can't mute yourself (Unless you unplug your mic) or others


Specs:

Processor	        Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU 930 @ 2.80GHz
Video Card        	NVIDIA GeForce GTX 480
Memory           	12 GB
Operating System	Microsoft Windows 10 64-bit

reviewText:
Total waste of money for the multiplayer. The Solo and offline modes are perfect when playing against the bot or with friends.

Multiplayer is awful, spammers everywhere, unrealistic double jumps, freaking laggy matches even with the full bars where when you make a substitution if will not work, very limited combos for each character and successif combos of support character from nowhere.

Without forgetting the lack of players on PC, we all know the database of players on PC compared to console.

And as a very big fan of Naruto since I was a child and fan of Naruto games I'm very disappointed by this edition. I regret my purchase because I can't refund it now.

The first Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm remains the best Naruto game ever made in my honest opinion.

If you are planning to play the multiplayer only you will not enjoy it.

reviewText:
TL;DR in the end.
I just finished the story mode of the game, played a few free battles and some more online battles, and with that I must say that this game is extraordinary!
Such a great addition to the Storm series.
What are you saying? This game has 50% of positive reviews and I'm say that it is an excellent game?
Let me tell you something mate, you see all of those negative reviews? 40% of them are people complaining that this games does not run at 60fps, other 40% are complaining about slowndowns.
20% are complaining about the game itself.
Now...About the 60fps issue"... The game runs at 30 fps. Is that an issue? No
date: moving on.\nSlowdowns... Why do they happen? Because your pc lacks the horsepower for this game.\nMy game runs at perfect 30 fps
recommended: it only drops to 20/15 fps when the screen splits to show more than one character (Team Awakening
hoursPlayed: Some ultimate jutsus and some Boss cutscenes. You know why I don't complain about these slowdowns? If I disable some graphical options (Low Shadows
voteText: Motion blur etc)
helpfulPercent: the game runs perfectly
votesHelpful:
so basically it's not the game that has a problem.

TL;DR
This game is amazing
votesTotal: if you're a Naruto fan this is an great addition to your collection. If the game has slowdowns it's because your pc can't fully handle it
votesFunny: it's not the game's fault."

reviewText:
(first review I've ever done) - Only reviewing it because this honestly angered me and many other customers.

I was honestly excited when I saw everything this had to offer.
I'll cut right to the point though
This game has good bones.
- good combat
- awesome characters from the naruto universe
- etc.

The list could go on.
But, unfortunately I am angry with this product.
It's problems start with the opimization which it has: NONE OF
I entered into the game and as I got to the title screen the lag was terrible
I felt like I was moving through sticky tar when trying to even play it.

Another issue that people have also complained about is there is really no keyboard options built into the game
Now I could care less about keyboard controls for a fighting game, but if your going to put a game on PC
you need decent keyboard controls.

Other issues include:
Pay Wall DLC to get to future characters
No clear instructions on how to use newer controls and what they do. CHANGING CHARACTERS FOR EXAMPLE
30fps locked in.
And other technical dificulties that I can't explain due to my lack of knowledge in the field of computers / computer gaming.

Side note: I've heard the console versions ended up being just as bad.

Thank you for taking the time to read this review.
Signed, Gilgamesh.

reviewText:
EDIT: AFTHER THE 12TH FEBRUARY PATCH, THE GAME WORKS LIKE A CHARM (even on a INTEL HD, I have a GTX 650 Ti 1 gb).
I don't recommend this game in therms of Lies.

1) They told us, this game was build from 0 for PC (Lie).

2) They told us the game will be the same for every platform (PC/PS4/XBOX1) Lie 2.

3) They told us, that this game was gonna be the best one and the first one at 60 fps and a great port (Lie 3).

Now: The game (day 1) has 4 problems:
1-Sound crappy (fixed by changing the quality of the device sounds to 48000 HZ or 41000 HZ, you can choose whatever you preffer).
2-FPS problem (not saying the 60/30 fps lie) in some places, the game drops till 15 fps and a few jutsus (powers in case you never played/watched any naruto game/movie/chapter before) and it's locked to 30fps.
3-Slowdowns even on fastest GPU (Nvidia GTX 960-70-80-AMD equals).

reviewText:
Hey Naruto fans,

I've never written a review for a game before but I felt like I needed to for NS4. I'm a huge Naruto fan, and I've spent hundreds of hours playing Ninja Storm 3 on my 360. I'm writing this review to inform you, a fellow leaf village ninja, on the positives and negatives of this game, the aspects that need to be worked on, and whether or not I think you should buy it right now.

Tournaments, endless mode, and ranked were what made NS3 so addicting. I've never focused too much on the campaign's quality or any of the side quests. I already read the manga and watched the anime so I didn't care too much about watching it all over again. The same applies to NS4 - I skipped through most of the cutscenes of the story mode because it was stuff I already knew, but the missions were definitely way more fun than NS3 were. They don't have a lot of walking around, it's strictly fighting, the boss fights were fun, and the ending of the game was superb. But the slideshow style cutscenes seemed like a lazy drawback. The adventure mode is dumb and collections are also a waste of time.

The fighting mechanics are amazing. I love the new round system and I really enjoy the way the supports have evolved. The characters are fun to play, some are a bit overpowered but balancing doesn't seem like a huge issue at the moment. The new maps are refreshing, and the wall running doesn't seem too useful.

I want to remind you that I did not play Revolutions, so I didn't know that spectator mode had already been removed somewhat from that game. It wasn't until buying NS4 that I realized that they took out the ability to watch your friends play in Endless or in tournaments. That is the biggest flaw with the game right now besides the terrible servers that constantly disconnect you from matches and pit you up against laggy players. CC2 also halved the size of the tournaments and endless matches from 8 players to 4 players. I couldn't believe it when I fought in my first tournament tonight. I immediately went out to see if CC2 planned on fixing this soon and had announced an upcoming patch, but no, apparently Revolutions had already removed spectator mode somewhat and many people had already made a petition to bring it back.

3000 people to be exact. You can sign this petition too here: https://www.change.org/p/bandai-namco-entertainment-cyberconnect2-hiroshi-matsuyama-perfect-the-online-environment-in-naruto-shippuden-ultimate-ninja-storm-4?recruiter=419566214&utm_source=share_for_starters&utm_medium=copyLink

Despite that, I do recommend this game to naruto fans. It's fun to play with your friends for a little bit, but can get repetitive and boring without spectator mode. You're stuck watching a screen that says Other players are fighting right now. Please wait." The campaign was good

reviewText:
Having about 3 hours into the game, I never regret my decision on pre-ordering this game. The mechanics are awesome and kept the same from ninja storm 3 but with more graphics and dynamics to the mix. This is my review so for.

Pros:

- Fun gameplay
- Tons of characters
- Graphics is flawless
- Motivating story (gets you going)

Cons:

- In story mode the voices in cutscenes play through your left speaker (left ear) while the music and background sounds play on both speakers
- Capped @30fps but still smooth
- Story mode isn't well animated compared to ninja storm 3 with their cutscenes, just screenshots with audio over it. But not all of the cutscenes are like that just some if not most.

As of now I'll give it a 7/10 since there are couple things need to work out. Hope this review was useful in my perspective! I have not yet tried adventure mode since I haven't finished the story, will update this review after that.

reviewText:
READ IF YOU'RE HAVING ISSUES ON A LAPTOP:

This game is running great! I'm running it with a 950m, there's a few hiccups here and there which will probably be optimized later, but other than that it's running at a steady 30fps (it's locked there, I can run most games at 60).

A lot of people seem to have trouble running the game on laptop, here's how to fix it:

Another anime game made my computer run it at 10fps max, it was terrible, and the solution is the same between both.
For some reason the game selects your default graphics card instead of the dedicated one, all you have to do is set your dedicated videocard to be used by default. on Nvidia it's on the control panel-manage 3dsettings-and select your nvidia card from the dropdown menu. Problem solved!

I love this game, and really feel shamed to be apart of such a prissy community.
The game is either too slow, or can't be appreciated because it's a has the nerve to be called next gen and not run at 4k and 60 FPS.
This a post gen gaming series, ported to next gen.
I mean would you feel better if the advertised as a Mid-Gen game, is that even a thing, is that good advertising?
I can't believe my game is crashing constantly, and i'm one of the few people that can appreciate how beautiful this game looks now.
People are already having issue with min rec specs and you want to up FPS, which doesn't sound good for online stability.
It's unfortunate that all PC players are not created equal, like console players.
Also I haven't heard any one say anything about the load times, I would call it next gen based on that alone.
Storm Rev had an insane load time for characters select and pre-battle.
You should at least be able to appreciate graphic limitations as it equates to instant load times.
I will play this broken game happily, until my crash issue is fixed.

reviewText:
I guess I'll give my own personal review of the game as well:

The Bad -
For starters, the game isn't playable for more than 10-15 minutes as it crashes, which makes it extremely difficult to get past the Madara vs Hashirama intro for the story; it crashes somewhere inbetween Madara + Susanoo covered Kurama vs Hashirama + Wood Golem and Hashirama's usage of Sage Art: True Thousand Hands against Madara. So for story mode, I wasn't able to get any progress saved and thus I would have to keep starting at the absolute beginning each time only to get to the same points in the story mode; this frustrates me very much. I've also noticed that some of the graphics were flickering as if the game were poorly optimized for the PC. While it happened to me(or I noticed it) only once, I don't particularly enjoy it. With all of these negative reviews floating around, I'm on high alert to notice anything out of the ordinary. So as of now, I'm only able to play in free-battles or anything along those lines; my progression in the game has been slowed severely because of the constant crashing. It is not acceptable.

The Decent -
Those are really my only bad experiences; I did experience low FPS during one of the opening cutscenes(I could clearly tell because of the images being really choppy and slow) but I made sure to have nVidia play the game at maximum performance, reboot it(I'm honestly sure you could just reboot and it will fix the low FPS issue. Although I am dissapointed that the game is only playing around 30FPS but every other Storm game played at it, and this particular game has some good animated effects. The game's fighting pace seems to be at a similar rate compared to the others; the game is beautiful graphically, etc. It has a good bit of the magic the other Storm games have. I've even noticed that the game has very short load times. I've also had decent sound, I haven't ran into any of the stated sound problems or they were just so weak that I couldn't tell the difference. Pre-ordering the game did pay off for me as I did get to have some short-lived fun with Boruto and Sarada, so basically I did get some enjoyment from the game. This game clearly has potential to be something.

The Verdict -
Well, I wish we had more of a scale-based rating instead of a yes or no, because I would've given this game around a 4-6  rating because some of the game was functional albeit for short periods of time, but because of this and the many small optimization issues I will have to say I will not recommend this game right now. Yes I'm aware of a patch or two that could help the game, but for one I don't totally trust them. I also believe that this game should've been optimized before release like this. I shouldn't have to apply a 3rd party patch from someone who didn't have a hand in any part of the production of the game. I shouldn't have to waste my time googling how I can make the game run without fps issues or how to avoid crashing; this should've been given to us as a solid game from the start. I love the Naruto series and I do believe the Storm games are one of the best 3D fighting games out there, so I'm not bashing the game because of any hatred. This game still has time to be saved if the right people would listen and act. I'd also like it if there was someone to report our problems to.

P.S.
Just so we are clear, I do meet the minimum requirements of the game:
Processor is a i7-4790k.
Graphics card is a MSI GTX 970 Gaming 4G, in which I just performed an update on it.
I have 8 GB ram and at least 10x the space needed to install the game, with everything wrapped in a Windows 10 package, with the appropriate drivers.

reviewText:
Waited so long for this game to come out, downloaded the game, start it, had some graphic issues, fixed it by editing ini file. Finally 1080P 30fps, finish the first fight, getting so pumped! Crashed, restart, no save, sigh... start again, progress further the second time, out of no where, crashed agian! Restart, no save :/

Spent 4ish hours in the game but only get to  play 2 hours worth of gameplay due to constant crashes and no being able to save.

Edit2: Finished the game, the game is definitely playable when you fix all the bugs(and dont mind 1080P@30fps) which you shouldnt in the first place. Overall I love the game because I am a huge Naruto fan, but as a pc gamer, the pain of finding solution for the bugs are not worth it. Bandai should patch the game in the future.


FIX IT, BANDAI!

reviewText:
Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 is the best Naruto game to date. The biggest cast of characters, new mechanics, etc. make for a great game.

Negatives first though:

-FPS lock. Can't go over 30FPS, but that's not a totally huge deal. Yes 60 would be better, but 30 ain't bad.
- 15 GB of cutscenes. All the full-motion story cutscenes are pre-rendered using the in-game engine and all have a soft, fuzzy look to them along with low anti-aliasing. It means you've got a fuzzy looking story while gameplay is bright and crisp. Not only is it a huge visual downgrade, but that's also a lot of extra hard drive space. The scenes aren't anything incredible so why they didn't just use in-game cut scenes is just baffling to me.
- Too many slideshows. There are plenty of cutscenes that aren't even animated and just use stills from the anime with some motion applied. It's lazy and, if they were going to go this route, why not just include all the actual animation from the series?
- Some bugs persist such as story mode dialogue audio only coming from the left channel, some crashing due to regular Windows processes, etc.

Positive time!
- Biggest cast of characters in any Naruto game. If you have a fan favorite, you can probably play them here.
- No longer are ultimate jutsu, awakening, and drive styles separated.
- Leader change system makes for fun combos and switching up of combat. It feels very fresh and fun.
- Love NUNS games? It's more of the same, just tweaked and improved all around.
- Replay story at whatever chapter you like. No need to start a new game.

I'd recommend it, for sure. Great game all around and sure to please Naruto fans. CC2 did a great job and, should they patch the issues, it'll be amazing.

reviewText:
Okay, here we go.

At this point in time my computer is only just slightly better than a toaster oven, but the game runs well enough for me not to tear it apart at every given moment, and that's at lowest settings without config edits. Is the game flawless? Hell no, it's in a shaky start. Does it deserve such terrible reviews, I honestly don't think so, this is no Arkham Knight. I don't know my exact specs, but my hardware is a few years old now, so it's not anywhere near top of the line. I'd give it a 7/10 in it's current state. I'll start with the Cons, to get the bad out of the way first.

Cons:
-30 FPS Lock, despite being said that this game would be optimized well on the PC.
-Slightly lower frames on menu screens. I go down 19 frames at most, usually it's around 24-27. Battles run pretty smooth.
-No option to turn off mics in online play. Seriously, why? I know how to do it, sure, but I want to be able to fight someone without hearing a tornado rip their homes apart.
-Slide show cutscenes in story mode. Seriously, this was a terrible desicion.
-Low framerate when awakening. Usually affects Susano'o characters.
-Crap keyboard support, as always. Doesn't overly matter to me since I have an Xbox controller to use, but still that should be better looked at.

I haven't experianced some of the other issues mentioned, so I can't comment on those.

Pros:
-Great story. Seriously it was nice to finally watch Naruto come to an end rather than the dub being 30 years behind and the sub being to caught up in the infinite filler to complete the story. (FYI I did read the manga, notice how I said watch") Loved how they handled the final battle.
-Animated cutscenes were great. Seriously if we had this quality of cutscenes during Obito's backstory
date: or when the mask fell off it would have been amazing. They all looked so well done
recommended: it's a shame a good portion was just a slideshow.\n-Better English dub acting. By far one of the highest points for me. In previous games several of the characters didn't show enough emotion in their lines. It's especially noticeable on Naruto when he shouts. This is the first time since Storm 2 that English Naruto's Rasengan actually sounds intimidating. This wasn't his actress's fault
hoursPlayed: but the people who handed her the script and told her to read it
voteText: and those who put weak sounding voices in the game rather than rerecording new ones.\n-Overall smooth gameplay. Minus awakening
