reviewText:
So this game started with a bit of a rocky release. That said, the patches have been major helps and there is far more consistent support for this game on PC than I personally expected and I have been pleasantly surprised with the game as a whole.

The game is what you would expect. The Story mode finishes off the series decently well. Some scenes are animated and some are stills. The best scenes were done very well (the last ones) and it was definitely an enjoyable experience. The adventure mode offers the ability to run around and see the areas (fighting arenas mostly) and talk with significant people. Definitely worth doing! It also gives you different memory" scenarios to relive all of the major fights in the original series and Shippuden.

The versus is great and the online is fun. Don't be off put by the overwhelming entrance punishment you'll likely receive your first trip to the online lobby. You'll do well in time and it makes the game all the more fun and challenging
recommended: the character roster is overwhelming in a good way. A decent amount of the moves are recycled from past games but the new additions are fun and worth playing for/with every time.\n\nIf you're a Naruto fan

reviewText:
Hey Naruto fans,

I've never written a review for a game before but I felt like I needed to for NS4. I'm a huge Naruto fan, and I've spent hundreds of hours playing Ninja Storm 3 on my 360. I'm writing this review to inform you, a fellow leaf village ninja, on the positives and negatives of this game, the aspects that need to be worked on, and whether or not I think you should buy it right now.

Tournaments, endless mode, and ranked were what made NS3 so addicting. I've never focused too much on the campaign's quality or any of the side quests. I already read the manga and watched the anime so I didn't care too much about watching it all over again. The same applies to NS4 - I skipped through most of the cutscenes of the story mode because it was stuff I already knew, but the missions were definitely way more fun than NS3 were. They don't have a lot of walking around, it's strictly fighting, the boss fights were fun, and the ending of the game was superb. But the slideshow style cutscenes seemed like a lazy drawback. The adventure mode is dumb and collections are also a waste of time.

The fighting mechanics are amazing. I love the new round system and I really enjoy the way the supports have evolved. The characters are fun to play, some are a bit overpowered but balancing doesn't seem like a huge issue at the moment. The new maps are refreshing, and the wall running doesn't seem too useful.

I want to remind you that I did not play Revolutions, so I didn't know that spectator mode had already been removed somewhat from that game. It wasn't until buying NS4 that I realized that they took out the ability to watch your friends play in Endless or in tournaments. That is the biggest flaw with the game right now besides the terrible servers that constantly disconnect you from matches and pit you up against laggy players. CC2 also halved the size of the tournaments and endless matches from 8 players to 4 players. I couldn't believe it when I fought in my first tournament tonight. I immediately went out to see if CC2 planned on fixing this soon and had announced an upcoming patch, but no, apparently Revolutions had already removed spectator mode somewhat and many people had already made a petition to bring it back.

3000 people to be exact. You can sign this petition too here: https://www.change.org/p/bandai-namco-entertainment-cyberconnect2-hiroshi-matsuyama-perfect-the-online-environment-in-naruto-shippuden-ultimate-ninja-storm-4?recruiter=419566214&utm_source=share_for_starters&utm_medium=copyLink

Despite that, I do recommend this game to naruto fans. It's fun to play with your friends for a little bit, but can get repetitive and boring without spectator mode. You're stuck watching a screen that says Other players are fighting right now. Please wait." The campaign was good

reviewText:
I love this game, and really feel shamed to be apart of such a prissy community.
The game is either too slow, or can't be appreciated because it's a has the nerve to be called next gen and not run at 4k and 60 FPS.
This a post gen gaming series, ported to next gen.
I mean would you feel better if the advertised as a Mid-Gen game, is that even a thing, is that good advertising?
I can't believe my game is crashing constantly, and i'm one of the few people that can appreciate how beautiful this game looks now.
People are already having issue with min rec specs and you want to up FPS, which doesn't sound good for online stability.
It's unfortunate that all PC players are not created equal, like console players.
Also I haven't heard any one say anything about the load times, I would call it next gen based on that alone.
Storm Rev had an insane load time for characters select and pre-battle.
You should at least be able to appreciate graphic limitations as it equates to instant load times.
I will play this broken game happily, until my crash issue is fixed.

reviewText:
I've only played for a few hours and I'm already enjoying the game. If I were to rate the game. I wouldn't be able to. The story is already so amazing. The graphics are beyond of what I thought it'd be. The game runs so smooth. I'm glad I pre-ordered. It's also fun playing Vs battle with my brothers and sisters. The game is so exciting, it's hard to rate it 10/10. I wish I could rate it 100/10 xD

Can't wait to finish the story. It's so emerging. Can't take a break from the game even for a minute. I feel bad for others that are having FPS problems. I first had the problem on my computer. So I moved onto a computer that had 2gb's of video graphics or w/e it's called (and it worked after that). You also need a very good graphics card to.. After playing the first minute of the game I realized why the game requires so much to play, and it also might be the V-sync doing something to your game. The FPS I got on my computer was 14fps. The reason I got that much is cause I didn't have a powerful enough graphics card. I met all the requirements for the game, but it's mainly the 2gb of vid graphics and the v-sync (prob doing something). Well that's what I think.

I hope other people can start playing their game sometime!

reviewText:
I've clocked in roughly 10+ hours, so this review will be based around actually experiencing the game. Story is great, The actual boss battles are a feeling only experiencing it can describe. The Storm restyle works great for it. Sadly the main problem with shifting away from Adventure is having Generation/Revolution style frame by frame pictures when the characters narration. However the game does have game engine cutscenes at time and when that kicks in. It's great

Without spoiling much, Without a doubt Storm 4 has the best boss battles. I haven't felt this awesome about facing a Boss since Pain in Storm 2.

I can't say much about Adventure because it's a niche mode. Either you like it, or don't. I've never been a huge fan of the open world Naruto style. Always the FreeBatlle/Story/Online for me. So I can't give a in depth opinion on it. However I will say it was a great idea shifting Story/Adventure away from one another.


Free Battle is and will always be the same.

Online Battles... I could write a huge blog on how the Netcode was garbage in other games and frankly, It's still pretty terrible with this game. Either you have full 1 Second lag or rarely 2 seconds. You better get used to playing .5 at least.
Balancing will always be an issue with Storm and that's a debate all on itself. Want good characters that work great in lag areas? Minato
Honestly, If they actually decide to spend time fixing the online battles, this game would be even higher rating. But sadly I can only really enjoy with friends around me or near states.




Final Conclusion: I think this is for sure the best Storm game to date.
8/10.

Roster and Costumes are great.
If you're a Naruto fan, this game is 100% amazing, but as a fan of both Fighting and Naruto. I have to judge it fairly and the netplay is a huge factor in that. Which is why this game is receiving an 8

reviewText:
READ IF YOU'RE HAVING ISSUES ON A LAPTOP:

This game is running great! I'm running it with a 950m, there's a few hiccups here and there which will probably be optimized later, but other than that it's running at a steady 30fps (it's locked there, I can run most games at 60).

A lot of people seem to have trouble running the game on laptop, here's how to fix it:

Another anime game made my computer run it at 10fps max, it was terrible, and the solution is the same between both.
For some reason the game selects your default graphics card instead of the dedicated one, all you have to do is set your dedicated videocard to be used by default. on Nvidia it's on the control panel-manage 3dsettings-and select your nvidia card from the dropdown menu. Problem solved!

reviewText:
I guess I'll give my own personal review of the game as well:

The Bad -
For starters, the game isn't playable for more than 10-15 minutes as it crashes, which makes it extremely difficult to get past the Madara vs Hashirama intro for the story; it crashes somewhere inbetween Madara + Susanoo covered Kurama vs Hashirama + Wood Golem and Hashirama's usage of Sage Art: True Thousand Hands against Madara. So for story mode, I wasn't able to get any progress saved and thus I would have to keep starting at the absolute beginning each time only to get to the same points in the story mode; this frustrates me very much. I've also noticed that some of the graphics were flickering as if the game were poorly optimized for the PC. While it happened to me(or I noticed it) only once, I don't particularly enjoy it. With all of these negative reviews floating around, I'm on high alert to notice anything out of the ordinary. So as of now, I'm only able to play in free-battles or anything along those lines; my progression in the game has been slowed severely because of the constant crashing. It is not acceptable.

The Decent -
Those are really my only bad experiences; I did experience low FPS during one of the opening cutscenes(I could clearly tell because of the images being really choppy and slow) but I made sure to have nVidia play the game at maximum performance, reboot it(I'm honestly sure you could just reboot and it will fix the low FPS issue. Although I am dissapointed that the game is only playing around 30FPS but every other Storm game played at it, and this particular game has some good animated effects. The game's fighting pace seems to be at a similar rate compared to the others; the game is beautiful graphically, etc. It has a good bit of the magic the other Storm games have. I've even noticed that the game has very short load times. I've also had decent sound, I haven't ran into any of the stated sound problems or they were just so weak that I couldn't tell the difference. Pre-ordering the game did pay off for me as I did get to have some short-lived fun with Boruto and Sarada, so basically I did get some enjoyment from the game. This game clearly has potential to be something.

The Verdict -
Well, I wish we had more of a scale-based rating instead of a yes or no, because I would've given this game around a 4-6  rating because some of the game was functional albeit for short periods of time, but because of this and the many small optimization issues I will have to say I will not recommend this game right now. Yes I'm aware of a patch or two that could help the game, but for one I don't totally trust them. I also believe that this game should've been optimized before release like this. I shouldn't have to apply a 3rd party patch from someone who didn't have a hand in any part of the production of the game. I shouldn't have to waste my time googling how I can make the game run without fps issues or how to avoid crashing; this should've been given to us as a solid game from the start. I love the Naruto series and I do believe the Storm games are one of the best 3D fighting games out there, so I'm not bashing the game because of any hatred. This game still has time to be saved if the right people would listen and act. I'd also like it if there was someone to report our problems to.

P.S.
Just so we are clear, I do meet the minimum requirements of the game:
Processor is a i7-4790k.
Graphics card is a MSI GTX 970 Gaming 4G, in which I just performed an update on it.
I have 8 GB ram and at least 10x the space needed to install the game, with everything wrapped in a Windows 10 package, with the appropriate drivers.

reviewText:
I've clocked in roughly 10+ hours, so this review will be based around actually experiencing the game. Story is great, The actual boss battles are a feeling only experiencing it can describe. The Storm restyle works great for it. Sadly the main problem with shifting away from Adventure is having Generation/Revolution style frame by frame pictures when the characters narration. However the game does have game engine cutscenes at time and when that kicks in. It's great

Without spoiling much, Without a doubt Storm 4 has the best boss battles. I haven't felt this awesome about facing a Boss since Pain in Storm 2.

I can't say much about Adventure because it's a niche mode. Either you like it, or don't. I've never been a huge fan of the open world Naruto style. Always the FreeBatlle/Story/Online for me. So I can't give a in depth opinion on it. However I will say it was a great idea shifting Story/Adventure away from one another.


Free Battle is and will always be the same.

Online Battles... I could write a huge blog on how the Netcode was garbage in other games and frankly, It's still pretty terrible with this game. Either you have full 1 Second lag or rarely 2 seconds. You better get used to playing .5 at least.
Balancing will always be an issue with Storm and that's a debate all on itself. Want good characters that work great in lag areas? Minato
Honestly, If they actually decide to spend time fixing the online battles, this game would be even higher rating. But sadly I can only really enjoy with friends around me or near states.




Final Conclusion: I think this is for sure the best Storm game to date.
8/10.

Roster and Costumes are great.
If you're a Naruto fan, this game is 100% amazing, but as a fan of both Fighting and Naruto. I have to judge it fairly and the netplay is a huge factor in that. Which is why this game is receiving an 8

reviewText:
Everything you need to know before buying the game: - sick graphic, all jutsu and ultimates looks a lot better than before (i recomend to play on full hd screen 👌)
-new gameplay mechanic, there is no lot of them but it change the game a lot, character switching works great and infinity combos are real
-30fps... sadly the game can run max 30fps on all pc's, yes there are programs to unlock it to more fps but i personaly hav not used any of those so can't rly recomend anything
-multipleyer, well there is nothing better in naruto games than sitting next to your friend and scream at him while making sick combos (thats true beuty of that game), and online mod just work its not bad or good it just work (as long as your connection is not powered by hamsters you gonna be ok)
-balance, in all fighting games gave to be that one character...  of cousre we talk about sasuke the last...  seriously that game should be called sasuke suns4 cuz level of players using sasuke in online battles IS TOO DAMN HIGH, all other characters seems pretty balanced tbh

So when if you readed all of that text you probably still ask yourself is it wortg to buy that game?"
If u are casual player it will be pretty decent i would rather wait for sale cuz for now that game is bit too expensive for me
But if u are Naruto fan that game is must have for you
recommended:
dynamic and you will probably rage a lot at online battles

I hope that this helped you with chosing the game :)
ps im rly sorry for my bad english :p"

reviewText: Although it started off rough, the team patched it enough to where it became playable. I loved the game and I think it's almost as good as 3, my only criticism being the anime slideshow-esque cutscenes rather than all of them being created originally like the other games. Overall, I highly recommend it to people who have enjoyed the series until now and to those who like fighting games. 8.5/10

reviewText:
